title: Mortgage Operations & Executive Support
description:
Executive Virtual Assistant – Mortgage Operations & Executive Support

Employment Type: Part-Time to Full-Time (Growth Opportunity)



Sapphire United Loans is a U.S.-based mortgage brokerage focused on agency, Non-QM, DSCR, and investor loan products. We are building a high-performance, systems-driven operation designed for long-term national growth.



This is not a basic administrative VA position. This role is for a highly experienced mortgage professional who can operate as an Executive Assistant and right hand to the Founder.



We are looking for someone who thinks ahead, anticipates problems, builds systems, and treats the business like their own.



Critical Requirement: English Fluency and Accent



You must:



Speak fluent, professional English



Have a neutral or American-sounding accent



Have no thick or heavy accent



Be comfortable making outbound calls to U.S.-based borrowers, lenders, escrow officers, and referral partners



You will be speaking directly with U.S. clients. Clear, confident, professional communication is essential. Applications without strong spoken English will not be considered.



Required Experience



Minimum 3+ years in the mortgage industry

5+ years preferred



Strong loan processing experience is required.



You must understand:



Conventional, FHA, and VA loans



Underwriting conditions (PTD and PTF)



Document review and file organization



Income documentation basics



Clearing conditions efficiently



Communication with lenders, title, and escrow



Loan disclosures and general fee structure



Experience with Non-QM and DSCR loans is a plus.

Experience with ARIVE or other LOS systems is a plus.



Primary Responsibilities



Mortgage Operations and Processing Support



Assist in setting up and organizing loan files



Review and help clear underwriting conditions



Communicate with borrowers regarding missing documentation



Coordinate with lenders, escrow, and title companies



Ensure files are complete and submission-ready



Help maintain compliance and quality control



Systems and Operations Development



Assist in building internal operations from the ground up



Help create and organize fee templates



Improve workflows within CRM and LOS systems



Identify inefficiencies and recommend improvements



Help create SOPs and documented processes



Executive-Level Support



Act as the Founder’s right hand



Anticipate needs before being asked



Track deadlines and critical items



Stay ahead of potential problems



Help structure priorities and improve operational flow



Ideal Candidate Profile



You:



Think proactively and strategically



Are extremely detail-oriented



See problems before they happen



Take ownership without being micromanaged



Want long-term growth and responsibility



Are comfortable operating at a high level



This role has the potential to grow into a full-time Executive Assistant or Operations Manager position for the right candidate.



Compensation



Compensation will be competitive and based on experience. Long-term stability and growth will be available for candidates who demonstrate ownership, reliability, and strong performance.



Application Instructions



To be considered, you must follow all instructions exactly. Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed.



Subject Line



Use this exact subject line:



SUL Executive Ops – [Your Full Name] – $3.5M File



Video Introduction (Required)



Submit a 2–3 minute video answering:



Your total years of mortgage experience



Your loan processing experience



Types of loans you have handled



Why you believe you can operate as an executive-level assistant and not just a task-based VA



This video will be used to evaluate communication clarity, accent neutrality, confidence, and professionalism.



Voice Recording (Required)



Record yourself reading the following exactly:



“Hi John, this is [Your Name] calling on behalf of Sapphire United Loans. I’m reaching out regarding the documents we’re still missing for your loan file. When you have a 
nt today, please upload your most recent paystubs and bank statement so we can keep your file moving forward. If you have any questions, feel free to call me back. Thank you.”



Processing Knowledge Question (Written Response)



Answer the following:



You submit a conventional loan and underwriting conditions return for:



Updated paystub



Letter of Explanation for a large deposit



Verification of Deposit



Updated homeowners insurance



Verification of Employment



Explain:



How you would organize clearing these conditions



What order you would prioritize them in



What you would communicate to the borrower



Systems Thinking Question



If you joined a mortgage brokerage that did not yet have strong systems in place, what are the first three operational improvements you would implement?



Confirmation Statement



Include the following sentence somewhere in your application:



I am ready to operate at a high level and treat this business like my own.



Only serious, experienced candidates should apply.

title: Graphic Designer/Social Media Manager
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION: 



We are seeking an experienced graphic designer/social media manager with sophisticated taste, exceptional communication skills, and deep knowledge of building a social media following.



We are a premium law + mediation firm launching next month.  We have brand guidelines, a brand voice, photo assets, a polished website, and several newsletters already finalized for launch.



Our audience is educated parents (ages 35–50) navigating divorce.



We have a vision for our social media presence, but we need someone with high level technical skill, efficient and proactive work habits, and deep knowledge of how to do everything from designing a one-sheeter to setting up a newsletter distribution system to creating tasteful, minimal instagram content.  We want to work with someone who has smart recommendations and has done all of this before.



We'd like this professional relationship to continue hopefully for several years.



Scope of Work



We are starting a business and starting our social media presence.  We need A LOT of help creating client-facing one-sheeters, presentations, and brand assets.



We need you to create a social media launch strategy.  What would be the fastest growing channels?  What would be the best approach given we don't have a lot of time to create content?  Etc.



Initial Setup (one-time)

Create and/or fully set up:

Instagram business account

Google Business Account

LinkedIn business page

Newsletter platform (Mailchimp / ConvertKit / Flodesk / Substack — your recommendation)

Possible Youtube

*Open to your suggestions



Set up a clean content system:

Canva templates (IG posts, quote graphics, YouTube thumbnails)

Shared folder structure

Simple content calendar



Requirements

Graphic design training

Proven experience repurposing long-form video into short-form clips

Portfolio examples required

Strong editorial judgment and professionalism

Comfortable working closely and collaboratively with client 

Experience with professional services brands

Experience launching social media accounts



Time & Budget

• Ongoing: 5-10 hours/week

• Setup: 30-40 hours total

• We require detailed invoices breaking down hourly charges



INTERVIEW PROCESS:



Our company is doing something completely original in the divorce space. We're hoping to find a social media manager/graphic designer who really understands our vision and brand and could hopefully work with us consistently long-term. To make sure we find the right long-term fit, our interview process involves creating sample work for us.  We pay for your time.



It's very similar work to what your job would be. You'll receive access to a folder that has all of the background you need to get a basic understanding of the company and some raw materials (newsletter and videos) to turn into social posts.

title: Digital Marketing Operations Manager (Right-Hand to CEO)
description:
***About Us***

We are a fast-growing digital marketing agency serving local service businesses (roofing, fire protection, tree service, gutters, HVAC, etc.). We deliver:



-WordPress websites (template-based)

-SEO

-Google Ads (+ LSA)


 & TikTok Ads (managed by Agency Elevation, coordinated internally)



We have a strong team and are scaling aggressively. The CEO leads strategy + sales and attends client meetings. We need a high-ownership operations leader to keep everything organized, documented, and executed.



***The Role (What you’ll actually do)***

You will be the CEO’s right-hand for client delivery and operations.



You will not be running campaigns day-to-day, but you must understand how our services work so you can:

-Track and push deliverables

-Hold owners accountable

-Ensure SOPs and checklists are followed

-Ensure tracking + reporting readiness before client meetings

-Coordinate with internal teams and Agency Elevation



***Key Responsibilities***

Client Success + Meetings

-Proactively schedule monthly client meetings on the CEO’s calendar 
 ? text ? call follow-up)

-Attend key client calls with the CEO, take structured notes, and track client sentiment (Green/Yellow/Red)

-After each client call: send recap + action items with owners + due dates

-Maintain a “client health dashboard” and flag risks early (unhappy client, lead drop, delays, tracking issues)



***Operations + Accountability***

-Run weekly internal check-ins and make sure tasks don’t get stuck quietly

-Coordinate across departments:

  -Website team (WordPress/Divi)

  -SEO team

  -Google Ads specialist

  -Agency Elevation (FB/TikTok)

-Escalate blockers quickly and consistently



***Systems + SOP Development***

-Build SOPs and checklists for:

  -Website delivery workflow

  -SEO monthly deliverables (including GBP photo collection and posting)

  -Google Ads + LSA monthly workflow

  -FB/TikTok coordination workflow with Agency Elevation (creative requests, landing pages, asset collection)

  -Lead tracking + qualification workflow (GoHighLevel + offline lead tracking)

-Your job is to turn “tribal knowledge” into repeatable systems so we can scale and onboard juniors.



***Tracking/Tech Coordination (high-level oversight)***

You must ensure processes are followed for:

-GoHighLevel forms + automations for lead tracking

-CallTrackingMetrics dynamic number insertion / call tracking

-Determining when to use:

  -main website vs landing pages

  -GoHighLevel landing pages (often 1 per ad group)

-Making sure conversion signals are being captured/qualified properly (offline lead tracking workflow)



***Tools We Use***

-Slack

-Zoom (record calls)

-Google Workspace

-GoHighLevel

-ClickUp (or similar project management tool)

-CallTrackingMetrics

-Agency Elevation (FB/TikTok fulfillment partner)



***Who This Is Perfect For***

You are:

-Highly organized, reliable, and proactive

-Comfortable pushing people and following up until tasks are done

-Strong in documentation and process building (SOPs, checklists, templates)

-Calm under pressure with clients

-Able to manage details but also understand the big picture

-Great written and spoken English



***Requirements***

-Experience coordinating projects and teams (agency experience is a plus)

-Strong communication + follow-up discipline

-Comfortable with client communication 
/text/calls)

-Working knowledge of digital marketing basics:

  -websites (WordPress), SEO, Google Ads, FB/TikTok Ads

  -tracking concepts (forms, call tracking, conversion tracking)

-Must be willing to work flexible hours when client meetings require it



***KPIs (How we measure success)***

-Client meetings scheduled on time every month

-Zero “quietly stuck” projects

-Action items completed on time (or escalated early)

-SOPs created and updated weekly

-Client health score maintained and improved (reduced churn risk)

-CEO can walk into client calls fully prepared with minimal prep time



***Trial Period***

-We start with a 7-day paid trial. During the trial, we’re looking for:

-Daily progress updates

-Structured notes + task follow-through

-Clear communication

-Proactive ownership



***How to Apply (include these in your application)***

Please answer the following:

1. Tell me about a time you had to enforce deadlines with a team. What did you do?

2. How would you build an SOP for a process that is messy and undocumented?

3. What tools have you used for project management and documentation?

4. What is your internet/power backup situation?

5. What are your DISC results (if you have them)?

title: Performance Video Editor & Designer
description:
About The Role

City Beauty is looking for a highly skilled and versatile Performance Video Editor & Designer to join our creative team. This is a high-volume, high-impact role focused on creating compelling video and static advertisements that drive revenue through paid ads.



Your primary responsibility will be to produce a steady stream of "thumb-stopping" video and static creatives, with a strong emphasis on Meta 
 & Instagram). You are a digital-native storyteller who understands how to build ads that convert, knows the Meta platform inside and out (including all UI safe zones), and thrives in a fast-paced, data-driven environment. This is a full-time remote position.



What You'll Do (Key Responsibilities)

-High-Volume Creative Production: Meet weekly output goals of approx. 10 (30 to 60 seconds long) and 10 static ads, iterating based on performance data and team feedback.

-Performance-First Editing: Create a wide range of marketing/advertising videos, specializing in editing UGC-style content, testimonials, and direct-response formats designed to drive action.

-Multi-Platform Adaptation: Create high-quality video and static creatives for all key social platforms, including Meta 
, Instagram), TikTok, and YouTube.



What We're Looking For (Qualifications):

-2+ years of professional video editing experience, specifically for paid social advertising.

-Expert-level proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects.

-Strong proficiency in static design tools, such as Adobe Photoshop or Figma.

-A strong portfolio that demonstrates:

      -Proven experience editing UGC and direct-response style social ads.

      -A diverse range of creative executions (both video and static).

      -A keen eye for design, typography, and motion graphics.

-Deep, technical knowledge of social media platforms, especially Meta 
/Instagram), including ad specs, formats, and UI safe zones.

-Passionate about video editing, design, and the social media landscape.

-Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment, managing a high-volume workload and multiple projects.

-High level of accuracy and an exceptional attention to detail.

-Self-motivated, proactive, and a collaborative team player.

-Professional and positive communication skills, both written and verbal.

title: Financial Analyst with Salesforce Exp
description:
Overview:



We are seeking a highly driven and strategic Financial Analyst to serve as a key partner to the executive leadership team. This role is ideal for a finance professional who combines strong technical expertise with business acumen and thrives in a fast-paced, data-driven environment. The successful candidate will transform complex financial data into meaningful insights, enabling informed decision-making that supports organizational growth, operational excellence, and long-term profitability.



Job Title: Financial Analyst

Location: Fully Remote

Job Type: Full-Time



Key Responsibilities



Executive Financial Partnership

Act as a trusted financial advisor to the CEO by delivering high-impact analysis, forecasts, and strategic recommendations.

Translate financial data into executive-ready insights that drive performance, scalability, and sustainable growth.

Develop financial models to support investment decisions, operational initiatives, and long-term planning.



Strategic Analysis & Business Intelligence



Identify emerging trends, risks, and opportunities through advanced financial and operational analysis.

Research market dynamics, competitor positioning, and industry benchmarks to strengthen strategic direction.

Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to evaluate business health and guide leadership decisions.



Syndication Leadership



Oversee syndication processes, ensuring seamless coordination between lenders, investors, and internal stakeholders.

Manage the preparation of documentation, payment processing, and distribution with precision and timeliness.

Safeguard compliance with syndication agreements and applicable regulatory standards.



Commission Oversight



Administer commission structures with accuracy and transparency.

Ensure timely calculations and disbursements while continuously improving process efficiency and controls.

Financial Accounting & Reporting Excellence

Lead Financial Accounting and Reporting activities, ensuring accuracy, integrity, and adherence to best practices.

Prepare executive-level financial reports, dashboards, and presentations that clearly communicate performance, forecasts, and strategic implications.

Strengthen reporting frameworks to enhance visibility and support data-driven leadership.



Operational Efficiency & Systems



Utilize advanced Excel capabilities to build dynamic financial models and automate reporting workflows.

Leverage QuickBooks expertise to maintain reliable financial data and support the full cycle of accounting.

Perform thorough bank reconciliations and implement controls that promote quality and financial accuracy.

Continuously identify opportunities to optimize financial processes and elevate reporting standards.



Required Skills & Qualifications



Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline.

Minimum of 3+ years of progressive experience in financial analysis, accounting, or financial management.

Demonstrated expertise in the full cycle of accounting, including reconciliations, reporting, and close processes.

Strong foundation in Financial Accounting and Reporting within a growth-oriented organization.

QuickBooks Certification or advanced working knowledge required.

Proven commitment to quality, accuracy, and strong internal controls.

Exceptional communication skills with the ability to influence and engage executive stakeholders.

Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including complex formulas, PivotTables, and financial modeling.

High level of analytical rigor with the ability to synthesize complex data into clear strategic insights.

Strong organizational skills with the capacity to manage multiple priorities independently.



Preferred Leadership Traits



Executive presence with a proactive, solutions-oriented mindset.

Strategic thinker capable of balancing big-picture vision with meticulous execution.

High degree of professionalism, discretion, and integrity when handling confidential financial information.

Adaptable, resilient, and comfortable operating in a dynamic, high-growth environment.

Collaborative partner who builds strong cross-functional relationships.

title: SEO Specialist
description:
About the Role



We are hiring a performance-driven Marketing Growth Specialist (SEO-Focused) to drive organic search growth, increase domain authority, and generate qualified inbound leads within the remote staffing and outsourcing space.



This role is primarily responsible for SEO strategy and execution, including keyword research, on-page optimization, technical improvements, and content structuring. Social media will serve as a supporting channel to amplify SEO-driven content and strengthen brand authority.



You will work closely with leadership to ensure measurable growth in traffic, rankings, and inbound lead generation.



Core Focus: Search Engine Optimization (Primary Responsibility – 70–80%)

Organic Traffic Growth

Conduct high-intent keyword research targeting startups, agencies, and international businesses

Optimize website pages, blogs, and landing pages for rankings and conversions

Improve on-page SEO elements (titles, headers, metadata, schema, internal linking)

Implement structured internal linking strategies



Technical & Structural SEO



Conduct technical SEO audits and coordinate fixes

Improve site structure, crawlability, and indexing

Monitor Core Web Vitals and site performance

Identify and resolve ranking issues

Content Authority & Topical Growth

Build topic clusters and pillar content strategy

Create structured content briefs aligned with search intent

Identify content gaps and competitor weaknesses

Strengthen domain authority through backlink opportunities



Secondary Focus: Social Media Support (20–30%)



Repurpose SEO-driven blog content into 
 and
 posts

Support thought leadership positioning

Maintain a consistent organic posting schedule

Track engagement and visibility metrics



(Social is positioned as amplification — not the main growth driver.)



Performance & Reporting



Track keyword rankings, traffic growth, and conversions

Provide clear monthly SEO performance reports

Monitor algorithm updates and adjust strategy

Measure inbound lead growth from organic channels



Requirements



2–4 years of hands-on SEO experience

Proven track record of improving rankings and organic traffic

Strong knowledge of on-page, technical, and content SEO

Experience with tools such as SEMrush, Ahrefs, Search Atlas, Google Analytics

Strong analytical and structured thinking skills

Experience in B2B, staffing, outsourcing, or SaaS is a strong advantage

Ability to work independently and own growth metrics



What Success Looks Like (First 6 Months)



Priority keywords ranking on Page 1

25–40% increase in organic traffic

Clear content cluster structure implemented

Improved internal linking and technical health score

Increased inbound leads from organic search

Consistent authority-building content distribution





Apply here:

title: Operations Associate
description:
Job Overview:

 We are seeking a proactive and versatile Operations Associate to ensure the smooth functioning of our operations and support business continuity. This role involves training new tea
mbers, stepping in when needed across departments, mastering internal tools, and continuously improving processes. The ideal candidate is highly adaptable, tech-savvy, detail-oriented, and thrives in a dynamic environment.



Key Responsibilities:



1. Training & Onboarding

Conduct training sessions for newly hired staff on company processes, client requirements, and tools.

Develop and maintain training materials, SOPs, and knowledge resources.

Monitor trainee progress and provide constructive feedback.





2. Backup Support

Provide cross-functional backup support during absences to maintain operational continuity.

Quickly adapt to different responsibilities while maintaining high-quality standards.

Identify process gaps and suggest improvements for smoother handovers.





3. Tools & Process Mastery

Learn and master all internal tools and platforms, including:

Salesforce (CRM and client management)

GoHighLevel (automation and client pipelines)

Zoom (team communication)

Google Workspace (docs, sheets, slides, drive management)

Serve as a go-to resource for troubleshooting and guidance on tool usage.

Document best practices and create guides for efficient tool use.





4. Continuous Upskilling

Stay updated with emerging digital tools, platforms, and methodologies relevant to operations.

Participate in training programs, webinars, or courses to enhance personal and team skills.

Suggest and implement innovative solutions to improve operational efficiency.





5. Operations Support

Assist in streamlining workflows, optimizing schedules, and improving task delegation.

Monitor and report on team performance, training effectiveness, and task completion.

Support management with ad hoc operational tasks as required.





Qualifications & Skills:

Proven experience in operations, administrative support, or a similar role ( preferably Real Estate) 

Strong ability to learn and master tools quickly, including Salesforce and other business software.

Excellent communication, training, and interpersonal skills.

Highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive problem solver.

Ability to adapt to varying responsibilities in fast-paced environments.

Familiarity with project management, CRM, automation, and collaboration tools.

Basic analytical skills to monitor team performance and workflow efficiency.





Key Attributes:

Adaptable and flexible mindset.

Initiative-driven and self-motivated.

Strong work ethic with commitment to quality and deadlines.

Passion for continuous learning and professional growth.

title: B2B SALES MANAGER (REVENUE OWNER ROLE)
description:
This is a remote role.



We’re hiring a commercial leader to own revenue across a portfolio of real estate services, SaaS products, and other solutions. 

This role is designed for someone who enjoys closing complex B2B deals, is comfortable speaking directly about money and outcomes, and wants meaningful ownership—not just a quota. 

You’ll work closely with the CEO, operate with real autonomy, and play a key role in shaping how we go to market as we scale. 

THE OPPORTUNITY 

This is not a narrow, single-product sales role. 



You will: 

Own the full sales cycle end-to-end 

Represent multiple high-value offerings 

Influence pricing, positioning, and deal structure 

Build long-term commercial relationships, not transactional wins 

If you’re at a point in your career where you want more responsibility, more trust, and more upside, this role is built for that. 



WHAT YOU’LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR 

Revenue & Pipeline Ownership 

Build and manage your own B2B pipeline through outbound outreach, referrals, and strategic follow-ups 

Engage directly with decision-makers across real estate, SaaS, and professional services 

Advance opportunities with confidence and commercial judgment 



Sales Execution 

Run effective discovery calls and demos focused on business outcomes 

Lead pricing, negotiation, and close conversations 

Identify and execute upsell, renewal, and cross-sell opportunities across brands 



Commercial Leadership 

Represent the CEO in sales conversations and negotiations 

Own key accounts through close and early lifecycle stability 

Surface new revenue opportunities and market insights proactively 



Accountability & Visibility 

Maintain a clean, accurate CRM (GoHighLevel preferred) 

Report weekly on pipeline value, close rate, deal velocity, and revenue performance 

Be measured on outcomes, not busywork 



WHO THRIVES IN THIS ROLE 

This role is a strong fit if you: 

Have 3 or more years closing B2B deals in SaaS, agencies, real estate services 

Are comfortable generating opportunities, not just handling inbound leads 

Enjoy consultative selling, negotiation, and problem-solving 

Can operate independently while collaborating with leadership 

Take pride in owning a number and improving it

Experience with GoHighLevel, real estate brokerages, or agency services is a strong advantage. 



GROWTH, COMPENSATION & ACCESS 

Base Salary: Competitive and aligned with experience 

Commission: Uncapped, performance-driven, and meaningful 

Growth Path: Clear runway to Director of Sales for the right performer 

Access: Direct line to the CEO and influence over sales strategy 

This is a role where strong performance is visible, rewarded, and expanded. 



OUR HIRING APPROACH 

We value real experience over polished resumes. 

Candidates will be asked to: 

Walk through deals they personally closed 

Explain how they handled hesitation or resistance 

Share real metrics including deal size, close rates, and pipeline ownership If you’ve carried revenue responsibility before, this process will feel natural.

title: VA Product Researcher
description:
I am looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to join my team as a Product Research & Personal Assistant VA. This role requires someone who is comfortable with repetitive tasks, managing data, and helping organize day-to-day operations. You will be responsible for researching profitable products, organizing data into spreadsheets, and assisting with administrative tasks that support business growth. Key Responsibilities • Conduct product research based on provided criteria • Organize and analyze data in Excel/Google Sheets • Create detailed and accurate reports for management • Assist with personal and business-related administrative tasks • Follow step-by-step processes with precision • Communicate updates daily through Slack/Skype/other messaging platforms Required Skills • Strong Excel/Google Sheets knowledge (formulas, sorting, formatting) • Excellent attention to detail and accuracy • Reliable, consistent internet connection • Good written and verbal communication skills • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision • Coachable and eager to learn new systems/tools Preferred (Not Required) • Previous VA or product research experience • Experience with data entry or research-based roles



Weekly/Monthly payments via Wise, or other agreed method • Long-term, stable position with room for growth • Bonuses for high performance and reliability How to Apply If you are interested, please send: 1 Your resume/CV 2 A short introduction about yourself and why you’re a good fit 3 A screenshot of your internet speed test 4 An example of a simple Excel/Google Sheets projects you’ve done.



Important Application Test (Read Carefully): When applying, include the number “27” at the end of your name in the subject line. Example: Product Research VA – John Doe 27 (If you do not follow this step, your application will not be considered. This is to ensure you’ve read the full job description.)

title: Social Media Manager (US Real Estate)  Full-Time Individual Contributor
description:
We’re looking for a growth-minded Social Media Manager based in the Philippines to work remotely and support a team of established, top-producing residential real estate agents.



**Important** This is a full-time role for one dedicated individual. We are not hiring agencies, teams, partnerships, or candidates who outsource or share responsibilities. Applicants must perform all work themselves.



Your Future Team



The Krishnan Team, founded in 2009 by Ruth Krishnan, ranks among the top 3 teams in San Francisco and has sold over $1B in real estate. What keeps them at the top is a strong culture of self-improvement, learning, and collaboration. The team fosters a fun, inclusive environment, and contributes 5% of revenue to community organizations.



The Opportunity



This is not a typical social media role.



You will work independently under the direction of a Marketing Manager, while collaborating with leadership to execute a sophisticated, data-driven content strategy.



This role is ideal for someone who:

*Thinks critically and asks thoughtful questions

*Takes ownership and executes without constant oversight

*Is curious, proactive, and committed to continuous improvement



You will shape the brand voice, transform raw content into compelling stories, and directly impact lead generation and market positioning.



The Role



We are looking for someone who is resourceful, proactive, and highly self-directed.



This is an individual contributor role. You are expected to:



*Manage your own workload and deadlines

*Execute all assigned tasks personally

*Communicate clearly and proactively

*Take full accountability for results

*You enjoy building scalable systems and creating content that drives engagement and business growth.



We Know You



You are:

*A self-starter who works independently without reliance on others

*Comfortable owning your work from start to finish

*Organized, detail-oriented, and deadline-driven

*Adaptable in a fast-paced environment

*Proactive in identifying opportunities and solving problems

*Willing to speak up, ask questions, and seek clarity

*You thrive in a role where you are trusted to deliver, take initiative, and continuously improve.



What You’ll Do



Content Creation & Video Editing

*Edit short-form video content (Reels) using tools like CapCut

*Transform raw footage into polished, high-impact content

*Write compelling, SEO-optimized captions using LLMs (e.g., Gemini, ChatGPT)

*Design graphics and carousels using Canva and AI tools





Social Media Management & Execution

*Manage day-to-day Instagram operations (posting, scheduling, engagement)

*Implement social SEO strategies (keywords, geo-tagging, alt text)

*Monitor trends and algorithm changes and recommend improvements



Analytics & Systems Development

*Track KPIs and translate performance into actionable insights

*Build and document workflows (e.g., Asana)

*Continuously optimize content and systems



Qualifications & Desired Skills

*Proven experience as a Social Media Manager or Content Creator 2+ years

*Strong video editing skills (short-form/Reels)

*Understanding of social media SEO and content strategy

*Strong copywriting and communication skills

*Highly organized and self-motivated

*Experience building systems and processes





Tools:

*Instagram,

*Canva, CapCut

*Google Suite



Later or similar scheduling tools

*Asana or similar project management tools

*ManyChat

*AI tools (ChatGPT, Gemini, Copilot)





Bonus:

*Experience in luxury real estate or high-net-worth audience



Requirements (IMPORTANT)



To be considered, you must:

*Be applying as an individual (not an agency, team, or partnership)

*Perform all work yourself (no outsourcing or subcontracting)

*Be available full-time (40 hours/week)

*Work during 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM PST

*Have a dedicated, distraction-free workspace

*Have reliable high-speed internet



***Applications from agencies, teams, or candidates intending to delegate work will not be considered.***



The Details

*Salary: $1,000–$1,800 USD/month, based on experience

*Benefits: Paid Time Off

*Location: Remote (Philippines only)

*Office: San Francisco, CA



Technical Requirements

*CPU: Intel/AMD 64-bit, 2GHz+

*RAM: 8GB+

*GPU: 2GB+

*Wired internet (minimum 10 Mbps)

*Headset



How to Apply



*Submit your resume in PDF format

*Include links to relevant work samples

*Do not contact the team directly

*Applications that do not follow instructions will not be considered.

title: Customer Service Support — Outbound Sales
description:
Turn conversations into conversions. Drive revenue through every customer touchpoint.

Department: Customer Experience & Revenue

Type: Full-Time | Remote

Reports To: Customer Service Manager

Compensation: 600 USD + Commission



ABOUT AJ MEDIA

We're AJ Media — an ecommerce growth agency behind fast-scaling brands including Gekko Gifts, Purvos, and Besyner. We're on a mission to hit $100M in revenue this year, and we're building the A-team to make it happen. If you're someone who gets energy from talking to people, closing deals, and genuinely helping customers find what they need — read on.

THE OPPORTUNITY

As our Outbound Sales Customer Service rep, you're not just answering questions — you're proactively reaching out to past and potential customers to drive repeat purchases, recover abandoned carts, and surface upsell opportunities. You are the voice of our brands.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

Proactively reach out to warm leads, abandoned cart customers, and past buyers via
, SMS, and phone

Execute outbound sales campaigns designed to increase repeat purchase rate and customer LTV

Identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities based on customer purchase history and preferences

Partner with the retention team to align outbound messaging with active promotions and campaigns

Log all customer interactions accurately in CRM tools (Gorgias, Klaviyo, or similar)

Hit and exceed weekly/monthly sales targets and KPIs

Collect and relay customer feedback to marketing and product teams to improve offers

WHO YOU ARE

You've got 1–3 years of outbound sales, telemarketing, or customer success experience (ecommerce a big plus)

You're a natural communicator — warm, persuasive, and genuinely curious about the people you talk to

You thrive with targets and you're not afraid of rejection — you see every 'no' as data

You're tech-savvy with CRM tools, helpdesks, and sales platforms

You can think on your feet, handle objections smoothly, and adapt your tone across channels

title: Business Analyst
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Business Analyst is solely responsible for owning, building, and delivering the Expansion Analysis (EA) and Target Market Analysis (TMA) components of the client-facing deliverable. This role transforms client data into actionable insights and collaborates closely with ETL, Client-Facing PR Teams, and Visual teams to ensure data quality, analytic integrity, and strategic alignment. The Business Analyst ensures that EA and TMA outputs are accurate, enriched, and directly tied to cohesive, data-driven recommendations.



ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES

Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, accountable, transparent, disciplined, aligned, and results-oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.



Wondering what it's like to work here? Come check this:


/watch?v=PIIv7sYj1Ns



SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

• Consistently deliver precise, insightful analyses that transform raw data into actionable insights, directly supporting client growth and decision-making.

• Ensure that each section of the client deliverable is cohesive and seamlessly aligned with other sections, creating a consistent and logically structured analysis that effectively communicates clear insights and actionable recommendations.

• Complete all analysis projects on time, maintaining a balance between speed and quality while meeting client expectations.

• Present findings in a clear, compelling manner, ensuring client teams and clients easily understand insights and receive actionable recommendations.

• Work seamlessly with cross-functional teams (ETL, Platform Review, and Visualization) to ensure accurate, aligned, and timely data analysis deliverables, proactively resolving data issues.



OBJECTIVES

• Deliver 5 high-quality EA and TMA analyses monthly, aligning with team deliverable targets.

• Ensure analyses achieve 100% accuracy and strategic alignment with internal and client expectations.

• Produce insights that inform client strategies, such as increased market penetration and customer retention.

• Conduct market selection analyses to optimize Total Serviceable Market Opportunity (TSMO).

• Accurately segment and analyze client customer bases to refine retargeting strategies.

• Maintain robust stakeholder engagement, regularly interfacing with cross-functional teams.

• Provide data clarity by ensuring datasets are structured and enriched for insight-readiness.

• Leverage tools like Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, and SQL for data analysis and visualization as well as various data aggregation tools and subscriptions.

• Support data pipeline validation and ensure data integrity across all reporting layers.

• Document and present findings in a clear, actionable format to inform strategic decisions.



COMPETENCIES

 • Expertise in data visualization tools like Power BI.

• Proficiency in Microsoft Fabric (Spark Notebooks, Lakehouse, Delta Tables).

• Strong ETL knowledge and ability to collaborate on data readiness.

• Advanced Excel, SQL, and familiarity with Azure Maps.

• Effective communication and stakeholder management.

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

• Ability to synthesize data into actionable insights.

• Adaptability and collaboration in cross-functional teams.



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

• Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, or a related field.

• 3+ years of experience in a similar role with a focus on market and customer analysis.

• Demonstrated ability to deliver high-quality insights under strict deadlines.

• Experience working with datasets for customer segmentation and market opportunity analysis.



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

• Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer

• Must be able to operate standard office equipment and work for extended periods at a computer.



COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce, Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates, and partners.



If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, please complete the online application form:


/

title: Content Creator & General VA
description:
Company: Hibbity

Work Hours: 8:00am – 5:00pm Philippine Time (1-hour lunch break)

Location: Remote (Philippines-based)



Salary: Negotiable based on skills, capability, and experience. Higher earning potential for candidates with proven expertise in curriculum design, digital content creation, or marketing strategy. Performance bonuses available.



About Us

Hibbity supports business owners, consultants, and growing companies with business services, digital support, and strategic projects. We operate across multiple brands and initiatives, which means variety, pace, and opportunity.

We are building a high-performance team and are looking for a Content Creator & General VA who can think, research, write, build, and execute.

This is not a task-based VA role. This is a thinking role.

If you can take a topic, research it deeply, structure it clearly, and turn it into powerful original content or even a structured course, we want to speak with you.



Role Overview

You will be responsible for researching topics, industries, and categories, then turning that research into:

Original written content

Structured course materials

Workbooks and learning resources

Blog articles and website content

Marketing and campaign materials

You must be able to work independently, think critically, and produce structured, professional-quality content without constant supervision.

Advantage if you can design structured courses including modules, lessons, assessments, and workbooks.



Key Responsibilities

Research & Content Development

Conduct deep online research on assigned topics, industries, or market categories

Analyse and synthesise information into original, structured content

Create clear, engaging, and practical written materials



Course & Curriculum Creation (Highly Valued)

Design structured learning programs including modules, lessons, learning outcomes, exercises, and assessments

Develop supporting materials such as workbooks, checklists, templates, guides, and toolkits

Translate complex business topics into practical, accessible learning materials



Content Creation

Write original content for websites, blogs, newsletters, and social media

Develop campaign content aligned with marketing objectives

Assist in content planning and execution across brands



Content Coordination

Prepare detailed briefs for graphic designers, video editors, and developers

Support content calendars and ensure deadlines are met

Work with the Manager to align content with strategic direction



General VA Support

Assist with research tasks and project coordination

Support documentation and internal resources

Provide reporting and updates as required



What We Are Looking For



You must:

Be able to research a topic from scratch and produce high-quality original content

Demonstrate strong writing and structuring ability

Think independently and take initiative

Have excellent written and spoken English

Be organised and deadline-driven

Be comfortable working across different brands and industries

Be available full-time during Philippine business hours

Strong advantage if you:

Have experience creating online courses or structured curriculums

Understand business, consulting, coaching, or professional services industries

Have experience with digital marketing content



What Success Looks Like

Clear, well-structured, high-quality content delivered consistently

Courses and materials that are professional and practical

Content that aligns with brand positioning and strategic goals

Reliable execution and ownership



Application Requirements

To apply, please submit:

A cover letter outlining your experience and why you are a strong fit

Your resume

A portfolio with relevant examples (courses, workbooks, blog posts, content pieces, etc.)

 your application to 
 with the subject line: Content Creator & VA – [Your Name]

Please include a link to your Online Jobs profile in the



Important Notes

Candidates will be required to complete a trial task

Initial engagement will be on a trial/probationary basis

This is a full-time, long-term position

Bonuses and growth opportunities available for high performers



If you are serious about content, structured thinking, and building meaningful work, we look forward to reviewing your application.

title: Virtual Assistant to Global Sourcing Specialist
description:
Job Title: Virtual Assistant (to Global Sourcing Specialist)



Company: Picnic Time, Inc. DBA Picnic Time Family of Brands



Picnic Time is a successful & sunny SoCal-based wholesale supplier of premium outdoor leisure, gift, and promotional products established in a garage in 1982. (Don’t worry, we have a real office now.) We know picnic, we love picnic, and we live picnic – it’s literally in our name.

Who we are: The Picnic Time Family is all about the people. We're a diverse team of hard-working yet easy-going people that care about what we're doing. If it weren't for the amazing group of people at Picnic Time, we wouldn't be where we are today.

What we do: We create quality products that are thoughtful, sustainable, and fun.  

When we do it:  We've been innovating since 1982 and we don't have any intention of slowing down.  The hope is that we'll be here creating great stuff for your kids' kids' kids!

Where the magic happens:  We were born in a small garage in West Hills, CA and moved to a bigger (ware)house in a small town, Moorpark, CA, in 1990.  We've been rockin’ the suburbs ever since!

Why we do what we do (this is the big one):  Our purpose for existing is to bring family and friends together so that they can make lasting memories...because that's what happiness is all about.  Each and every decision we make is ultimately geared toward that goal.

How we do it:  We're constantly driving towards our purpose via our 8 core values of Fun, Growth, Integrity, Collaboration, Innovation, Service, Productivity, and Passion.



Mission Statement: To create products that inspire friends and family to come together and make lasting memories – and have a great time doing it.



Job Description: Under the direction of our Global Sourcing Specialist, you will work to source products from around the world that meet the design, quality and pricing needs of our retail customers for private label and special direct import programs.



Role Overview

We are looking for a highly organized and detail-oriented Global Sourcing Specialist to manage our international supply chain and product development cycle. In this role, you will be the primary bridge between our design/sales teams and our global manufacturing partners (with a heavy focus on our partner factories in China). You will be responsible for obtaining competitive quotes, managing sample development, and ensuring that our production timelines and quality standards are met for every project.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

•	Factory Liaison: Act as the main point of contact for international factories, managing daily communication regarding production status, material availability, and lead times.

•	RFQs & Quotations: Manage the Request for Quote (RFQ) process; analyze factory quotes to ensure accuracy and competitive pricing, while maintaining target profit margins, and calculate landed costs for customer price quotes. Extensive use of MS Excel and Google Sheets.

•	Product Development: Oversee the sample lifecycle from initial concept and swatches to final pre-production approval. 

•	Tech Packs: Collect all product data, BOM's, and all item specific information needed to complete Tech Packet in product development software.

•	Quality & Compliance: Ensure all products meet client specifications and regulatory standards. Review third party inspection reports for compliance.

•	Strategic Sourcing: Works within the Global Sourcing team to develop strategic item assortments for seasonal buys and specific buyers. Study market trends and do competitive analysis and research

•	Digital Library (Salsify): Maintain a digital sample library of potential products in a Product Database (Salsify). Collect new catalogs from factories and all new items and input them into Salsify.

•	Sales Presentations: Must be comfortable creating presentations in PowerPoint, using snipping tool, and Excel.

•	Interdepartmental Communication: Must be comfortable communicating with all departments including Sales, Licensing, Product Development, Logistics, and Promotional teams. 

________________________________________

Qualifications & Skills

•	Experience: 3–5 years in global sourcing, procurement, or product development (consumer goods preferred). A good eye for products that are on trend and fit customers’ needs. Applicant must be proficient in Excel, Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator.

•	Communication & Organization: 

o	Communication: The ability to manage change and prioritize tasks with frequent interruptions are vital to this position, as well as being able to determine the best way to catalog and communicate information in writing (documents/emails) and visual aids (photos/illustrations) to ensure product consistency from one order to the next order

o	Organizational Excellence: Applicants must be organized with good time-management skills, be self-directed yet be able to take direction and ask questions, be good problem solvers with critical thinking skills, focused on effectiveness, efficiency, and must possess competent written and verbal communication skills. 

•	Technical Proficiency: Strong Excel skills (v-lookups, pivot tables) and experience with ERP/PLM software. 

•	Analytical Mindset: Ability to spot pricing discrepancies and analyze cost breakdowns (e.g., nesting vs. individual packaging).

•	Attention to Detail: Meticulous in tracking multiple projects simultaneously without losing sight of small specifications like Pantone colors or material finishes.

________________________________________

Bonus Points If You Have:

•	Experience with specific materials (e.g., textiles, wood, metals).

•	Prior experience in the promotional products or consumer goods industry.





Reports to: Global Sourcing Specialist, Supply Chain Department



Location: Remote – VPN access to virtual desk in Moorpark, CA 93021, USA

Hours: 8 AM –4:30 PM Monday – Friday PST (West Coast USA)

Salary: US$5 per hour (Paid $400 every two weeks) 

Employee Type: Contract 40 hours per week

title: HR & Payroll Assistant
description:
GH Logistics is a high-performance freight brokerage and asset based logistics company specializing in dry van and refrigerated freight. We move quickly, but we move with structure. Our company is built on accountability, compliance discipline, and operational integrity. We believe strong people processes create strong performance. If you value organization, confidentiality, compliance, and structured systems, you’ll feel right at home here.



Role Overview

As an HR & Payroll Assistant, you serve as the control point for employee documentation, benefits administration, onboarding support, and compliance record keeping. Your primary responsibility is to ensure all employee files, benefits records, and HR documentation are complete, accurate, and audit ready at all times. This role is ideal for someone who thrives on structure, protects confidential information with care, and ensures no documentation gaps exist from offer letter to termination



What You’ll Be Doing

• Assisting in employee benefits, including enrollments and terminations

• Auditing benefits records to ensure compliance and accuracy

• Managing and maintaining organized personnel files

• Ensuring I-9 documentation is complete, accurate, and compliant

• Preparing documentation for internal and external compliance audits

• Drafting and issuing structured offer letters

• Supporting onboarding and offboarding documentation processes

• Assisting with payroll related documentation (payroll experience is a plus)

• Preparing structured HR reports for leadership

• Sending professional written communication to drivers and tea
mbers

• Proactively following up on missing documents, signatures, or compliance requirements



What Success Looks Like

• Personnel files are complete, organized, and audit ready at all times

• Benefits enrollments and terminations are handled accurately and on schedule

• I-9 documentation remains compliant with no gaps

• Offer letters are structured, error free, and professionally formatted

• Payroll support documentation is organized and timely

• Compliance audits run smoothly with complete documentation

• Leadership receives accurate and organized reports

• Follow ups happen without being asked

• Sensitive information is handled with strict confidentiality



Who We’re Looking For

• Human Resources experience strongly preferred 

• Payroll experience is a plus

• Experience working in a US Human Resources is a plus

• Strong written and verbal communication skills

• High discretion and confidentiality

• Detail obsessive and documentation focused

• Process oriented mindset

• Able to manage multiple priorities without reminders

• Strong proactive follow up discipline

• Comfortable operating in a high performance and structured environment

• Self directed and highly accountable

• Follows structured processes and values accountability

• Coachable, team oriented, and open to feedback



Why Join GH Logistics?

• Permanent remote work environment

• Structured systems and clear expectations

• Direct leadership support and feedback

• Defined KPIs and measurable growth path

• Opportunity to grow within a scaling logistics organization

• Performance based advancement



Schedule & Work Setup

• Full Time Remote | Direct Hire to U.S. Company

• Monday – Friday | 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM CST (San Antonio Time)

• Zoom presence required (camera on)

• Time tracking software used for accountability and performance support



This role is built for someone who genuinely enjoys clean documentation, structured HR systems, and compliance discipline.



If you take pride in maintaining organized personnel records, protecting confidential information, and ensuring every employee file is complete and compliant, you’ll fit right in.



Apply Here:

 sure to split these two documents and on the cover letter ensure you clearly articulate your relevant experience including which firms you have worked for and for how long. Please ensure in the cover letter you address the following as a ranking out of 10. Ability to compare quotes for insurance, preparation of all necessary documents for a SOA, insurance claims, technical knowledge of difference insurance types, technical knowledge of exclusions and exemptions. 



Thanks

title: Go High Level (GHL) Automation Specialist
description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY



We are an established remote support services company that partners with growing businesses to streamline operations, improve marketing systems, and implement scalable automation. With over a decade in business, we help clients work smarter, respond faster, and drive measurable growth. We are selective about who joins our team because our clients expect high-level expertise and reliable results.



--------------------------------------------------



ROLE OVERVIEW



We are hiring a Go High Level (GHL) Expert who will work directly with one or more clients to build, optimize, and maintain their Go High Level systems.



This is not a basic VA role. We are looking for someone who deeply understands Go High Level and can design, automate, troubleshoot, and optimize full client workflows. You will act as the technical and strategic owner of the client’s GHL environment — ensuring their CRM, pipelines, automations, and campaigns run smoothly and drive results.



The ideal candidate is proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable translating business goals into efficient GHL systems.



--------------------------------------------------



WHAT YOU WILL DO



CRM & PIPELINE MANAGEMENT



- Build and maintain Go High Level CRM structures, including contacts, custom fields, and segmentation.

- Create and optimize sales pipelines aligned with each client’s sales process.

- Maintain strong data hygiene through regular audits of contacts, opportunities, and tags.

- Import, export, and migrate data as needed.

- Set up lead routing, assignment rules, and opportunity workflows.



AUTOMATION & WORKFLOW DEVELOPMENT



- Design and implement advanced GHL workflows and automation sequences.

- Build multi-step nurture campaigns using
, SMS, voi
 drops, and behavioral triggers.

- Troubleshoot broken automations and optimize for performance and deliverability.

- Implement conditional logic, wait steps, and behavior-based automation.

- Monitor automation performance and continuously recommend improvements.



FUNNEL & LANDING PAGE SUPPORT



- Build and optimize funnels, landing pages, and forms inside Go High Level.

- Connect forms and surveys to the correct workflows and pipelines.

- Ensure mobile responsiveness and follow basic conversion best practices.

- Implement tracking pixels and attribution where required.

- Conduct basic A/B testing when needed.



, SMS & CAMPAIGN MANAGEMENT



- Set up and manage
 marketing campaigns within GHL.

- Configure SMS and voi
 campaigns following compliance best practices.

- Support domain warm-up and monitor deliverability.

- Manage unsubscribe handling and suppression lists.

- Analyze campaign metrics and recommend optimizations.



INTEGRATIONS & TECHNICAL SETUP



- Connect Go High Level with third-party tools (Zapier, Stripe, Google,
, etc.).

- Configure calendars, booking systems, and appointment workflows.

- Set up domains, DNS records, and
 sending services (SMTP, Mailgun, etc.).

- Troubleshoot integration and API-related issues.

- Support sub-account and white-label environments when required.



REPORTING & OPTIMIZATION



- Build and maintain client dashboards and reports.

- Track key metrics such as lead flow, conversion rates, and campaign performance.

- Provide clear weekly or monthly performance summaries.

- Identify bottlenecks in funnels or pipelines and recommend fixes.

- Continuously improve systems for efficiency and scalability.



CLIENT SUPPORT & COMMUNICATION



- Translate client goals into effective GHL implementations.

- Provide clear progress updates and system status reports.

- Document SOPs for workflows and account structures.

- Train clients or internal tea
mbers on basic GHL usage when needed.

- Proactively identify opportunities to improve client setups.



--------------------------------------------------



WHAT YOU NEED (REQUIRED)



- 3+ years of hands-on Go High Level experience managing real client accounts.

- Proven experience building workflows, pipelines, funnels, and automations in GHL.

- Strong understanding of CRM best practices and lifecycle marketing.

- Experience with
 marketing, SMS campaigns, and lead nurturing systems.

- Solid technical comfort with integrations (Zapier, webhooks, basic APIs).

- Excellent written and spoken English communication skills.

- Highly organized with strong attention to detail.

- Proactive mindset — you identify and solve problems independently.

- Reliable high-speed internet and professional remote workspace.

- Availability overlapping U.S. business hours.



--------------------------------------------------



NICE TO HAVE (STRONG PLUS)



- Experience in agency or multi-client GHL environments.

- White-label GHL or SaaS mode experience.

- Funnel conversion optimization experience.

- Basic HTML/CSS knowledge for funnel customization.

- Experience with
 Ads or Google Ads tracking.

- Familiarity with other CRMs (HubSpot, Salesforce, ActiveCampaign).

- Copywriting experience for nurture sequences.

- Experience documenting SOPs and training teams.



--------------------------------------------------



WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE



- Client pipelines remain clean, accurate, and easy to manage.

- Automations run reliably with minimal errors.

- Lead response times improve through smart workflow design.

- Campaign performance steadily improves through optimization.

- Clients feel confident and well-supported in their GHL systems.



--------------------------------------------------



WHY CONTRACTORS CHOOSE US



- WORK FROM ANYWHERE — Fully remote role with location flexibility.

- LONG-TERM STABILITY — We prioritize ongoing client engagements.

- RELIABLE PAY — Competitive compensation with consistent, on-time payments.

- HIGH-LEVEL WORK — Work on meaningful automation and growth systems.

- SUPPORTIVE TEAM — Collaborative remote environment with knowledgeable peers.

- LEARN AND GROW — Exposure to diverse industries and advanced automation builds.

- ESTABLISHED COMPANY — Over a decade in business with continued growth and stability.



--------------------------------------------------



APPLY HERE



To submit your application, visit: 
/4r2fYcm

title: Content Strategy & Growth Lead
description:
1. The Three Pillars of the Role

Pillar 1: Search & Discovery (The "Growth" Engine)

• The Mandate: Own the organic funnel. It’s not just about "SEO keywords"; it’s about Search Intent, visibility and sediment

• Key Tasks: Keyword gap analysis finding what our competitors rank for using semrush, technical SEO audits, and managing llm’s and AI content visibility.

• "Product-Led Content" designed for DIY (e.g., how a blog post directly leads a user to sign up for your service).

• KPIs: Organic traffic growth, Keyword rankings (Top 3/Top 10), and Backlink profile strength. 

• Local SEO on the gmb map pack ( update services and postal code, use gimp to edit meta data / gps geo tag) questions and reviews

• Identify best software’s and request for Kpi’s and business goals.

Pillar 2: Authority & Conversion (The "Strategy" Engine)

• The Mandate: Establish the brand as a "Thought Leader" in drywall using AI and semrush reports to answer queries and questions

• Key Tasks: Developing Lead Magnets (PDFs, templates, tools) that capture
s, and setup quotes through website and
s. Think
 campaigns

• KPIs: Conversion Rate lead generation.

Pillar 3: Community & Distribution (The "Social" Touch)

• The Mandate: Social media shouldn't be a silo; it’s a distribution channel for the content built in Pillars 1 and 2 leading to engagement and lead generation.

• Key Tasks: "Content design and implementation on IG,
, other along with google ads

• KPIs: Engagement Rate, Social Share of Voice, and Referral Traffic from social to the website.



Role Overview



The Content Strategy & Growth Lead is the digital architect of the company’s local market dominance. Unlike a traditional writer, this lead is responsible for the entire "Lead-to-Contract" lifecycle. They manage website and customer brands as a high-performance sales asset, using SEO to drive discovery, AI-augmented content to build authority, and GHL automations to convert local Edmonton traffic to estimates across various service based business.

________________________________________

II. The Role Matrix: Responsibility vs. Impact

How the Lead’s effort translates into business results.

Focus Area Core Responsibilities GHL / Technical Integration Business Impact (KPI)

Strategy (50%) Keyword gap analysis, Technical SEO audits, AI Content management, and competitor 
e SEMrush  GHL Dashboards & GA4: Tracking lead source attribution and pipeline value. Organic Dominance: Ranking in Top 3 for drywall keywords and sediment (long tail and phrase) and the GMB Map Pack.

Creation (30%) Writing SEO blogs, Lead Magnets (PDFs), Case Studies, and high-conversion landing page copy. GHL Funnels &
 Builder: Building the lead capture forms and automated nurture sequences. Conversion Velocity: Increasing the ratio of site visitors to "Request a Quote" submissions.

Social (20%) GMB Map Pack optimization, content "atomization" (IG/FB), and geo-tagging project photos. GHL Unified Inbox: Monitoring DMs and GMB reviews to drive the "Speed-to-Lead." Brand Authority: Improved local sentiment and consistent "Social Proof."

________________________________________

III. Detailed Job Scope

This role is categorized into three functional "Engines" that power the growth of the business.

1. The Growth Engine (Search & Discovery)

• Local SEO & GMB: Owning the Edmonton Map Pack. This includes updating services and using GIMP to embed GPS metadata/geo-tags into job site photos to signal hyper-local relevance to Google.Targeting the new construction areas for drywalling basements.

• Search Intent & Sentiment: Moving beyond keywords to understand why customers search (Drywall repair vs. new basement drywall services). Managing LLMs and AI to scale content while maintaining a "human," trustworthy tone.

• Product-Led SEO: Crafting blog posts on topics that solve a problem and immediately offer a solution (e.g., "Fixing Ceiling Cracks" links to a "Book Repair" form) and social media to produce funnel.

• Design and execute a backlink program with paid and shared links.

• Enter/submit to local directories increasing citations and checking backlinks

2. The Strategy Engine (Authority & Conversion)

• Thought Leadership: Positioning the company as the "Edmonton Expert" by creating authoritative guides on Alberta-specific construction standards, humidity control, and soundproofing. Talk with area lead. 

• Lead Magnet Loop: Designing and implementing high-value assets (e.g., The 2026 Edmonton Basement Finishing Cost Guide) to capture
s within GHL funnels.

• Automated Nurture: Writing and managing weekly newsletters and SMS/Email sequences that educate leads who aren't ready to book an estimate immediately. This would be focused on the builder/renovation/condo management companies.

3. The Interaction Engine (Community & Distribution)

• Omnichannel "Atomization": Taking one core asset (like a project case study in Glenora or Windermere) and distributing it across IG, FB, and GMB to ensure consistent brand visibility. Or other target videos like 2026 Edmonton Basement Finishing Cost Guide

• Unified Inbox Mastery: Managing the GHL "Conversations" tab to ensure every inquiry from the website or social media is moved into the "Opportunities" pipeline within minutes.

________________________________________

IV. Typical Same 8-Hour Day (Integrated Workflow) Input needed

• 08:00 – 09:00 | The "Front Line": Manage the GHL Unified Inbox. Respond to new Edmonton quote requests, reply to GMB reviews, and handle any social 
eck with team for manual crm from phone call or leads in
 inbox or google workspace

• 09:00 – 11:00 | Deep SEO & Geo-Targeting: Audit example 
 for technical errors and communicate with website developer. Perform keyword gap analysis against local competitors. Process new project photos in GIMP with geo-tags for the GMB Map Pack.

• 11:00 – 12:30 | Authoritative Creation: Use AI to draft, then manually polish, a high-value blog post for the website focused on a specific service (e.g., Taping & Finishing). Or other recommendation off Semrush

• 12:30 – 13:30 | Break

• 13:30 – 15:00 | Funnel Architecture: Log into GHL to build/update a landing page. Design the "Lead Magnet" delivery workflow and ensure all forms on the domain are working perfectly.

• 15:00 – 16:30 | Social Distribution: "Atomize" the morning’s blog post into a series of visual updates for IG/FB and GMB. Launch/Monitor social ads if applicable.

• 16:30 – 17:00 | Data & KPI Audit: Review GA4 and GHL Dashboards. Analyze why traffic changed and update the "Growth Scorecard" for the business goals.

title: Data Engineer
description:
We are seeking a highly driven, hands-on Data Engineer to own and execute our end-to-end data architecture — from requirements definition to system design, implementation, deployment, and long-term operations.

You will build and operate scalable, production-grade data infrastructure that powers analytics, AI systems, and GIS workloads. This role requires both strong engineering fundamentals and a DevOps mindset — you will not only build systems, but deploy, monitor, and maintain them in cloud environments.



Key Responsibilities

 End-to-End Data Ownership

- Translate business and product requirements into scalable technical solutions

- Design clean, maintainable data architecture and workflows

- Implement robust ETL/ELT pipelines

- Ensure long-term maintainability, monitoring, and optimization

- Own deployment, reliability, and ongoing operations



Cloud Infrastructure & DevOps

- Architect and manage cloud infrastructure on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

- Work with Firebase and managed services

- Containerize and deploy services using Docker

- Implement CI/CD workflows using GitHub

- Ensure high availability, scalability, and cost efficiency

- Establish logging, monitoring, and data governance standards



Data Engineering & Systems

- Build and maintain batch and streaming pipelines

- Design and optimize PostgreSQL schemas, indexing, and performance

- Implement data validation, observability, and reliability checks

- Support AI-driven and GIS-based data workflows



Must-Have Technical Skills

Hands-on production experience with:

- PostgreSQL (schema design, indexing, performance tuning)

- Python (modern dependency management, uv preferred)

- Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

- Firebase

- Docker (containerization & deployment)

- GitHub (version control, CI/CD workflows)

You must be capable of independently deploying and maintaining systems in production.



Nice to Have (Strong Plus)

Experience with GIS / Geospatial systems, such as:

- Shapely

- QGIS

- GDAL

- GeoPandas

- H3

- Google Maps API

Experience working with spatial datasets, spatial indexing, or map-based analytics is a significant advantage.



Experience Requirements

- 3–5 years of experience in Data Engineering or related roles

- Strong foundation in data systems and backend software engineering

- Experience building and operating production-grade systems

- Experience working with cloud-native architectures



Soft Skills

- Fluent in English (written and spoken)

- Clear, structured communicator

- Collaborative, low-ego, team-first mindset

- Self-driven and proactive

- Strong ownership mentality — you finish what you start

- Comfortable leveraging AI-assisted coding tools to improve productivity



Preferred Background

- Experience working in remote or distributed teams

- Startup or fast-paced environment experience

- Exposure to AI-coding



Submit your application along with your resume and portfolio link in a google drive link.

title: Outbound Hunter / Appointment Setter for High Ticket Sales Agency
description:
We partner exclusively with high-ticket direct response brands (Fitness, Coaching, BizOp) running offers between $5,000 and $20,000+ with 30-day deal cycles.



Our clients are spending $50k+ a month on ads and they are drowning. We don't sell them "closers," we sell them a system to fix their leaky pipelines.



The Mission:

Your only job is to find these whales and book them for a Pipeline Stress Test. You are targeting founders who have the lead flow but lack the infrastructure to handle it.



Application Requirement (Do not ignore):

If you send a resume, I’m deleting it. To get an interview, answer these 3 things:



How are you going to find companies running $5k - $20k offers that are currently scaling their ad spend? Tell me exactly which tools or footprints you look for to prove they are a "Whale" and not a "Dog."



How do you target a founder who is currently getting 100+ DMs a day? What is your specific angle to get them to hand over their CRM data for an audit?



Explain your understanding of a 30-day high-ticket sales cycle. Why does Superpipe focus on this specific window instead of long-term enterprise sales?

title: Virtual Assistant (Xero + Admin + UK Client)
description:
Are You a Bit… OCD?



(That’s Organised, Capable, and Dependable, just to be clear.)



If you love structure…

If an organised inbox brings you peace…

If you get genuine satisfaction from keeping things moving and making sure nothing slips…



Then this might be the perfect role for you.



I’m looking for a Virtual Assistant who is reliable, hungry to work, proactive, and able to think on their feet — not someone who needs micromanaging or waits for instructions.



Xero experience is essential (you don’t need to be an expert — just confident using it).



THE ROLE (15–20 hours/week)



Admin & Operations



Inbox management, follow-ups, tracking tasks, and keeping things organised



Updating sheets, dashboards, SOPs



Liaising with property agents, brokers, contractors (light admin follow-up, not full lettings work)



Bookkeeping (must have experience)



Xero bank reconciliation



Coding transactions



Uploading receipts, matching invoices



Flagging discrepancies



AI / Tech



Using ChatGPT to summarise
s, organise info, build templates, create SOPs



Willing to learn simple AI tools 



UK Property experience is NOT required but helpful 



Task Flow

Some weeks will be busier, some quieter.

You’ll still be paid the agreed hours, but you must be okay with the rhythm changing.



REACTIVE TASKS (Non-negotiable)



You must be reachable during UK daytime hours for occasional urgent tasks.



This isn’t all day and doesn’t happen constantly — but when it does happen, it matters.



Examples:



Chasing a broker/agent



Approving something quickly



Resolving a simple issue



Checking a Xero transaction



You won’t be “on call” full-time — just reachable and responsive.



WHAT I’M LOOKING FOR



Hungry, reliable, and committed



Works independently without micromanagement



Communicates clearly & consistently



Handles deadlines without stress



Thinks ahead



Can organise chaos and keep things moving
