title: Personal / Executive Assistant
description:
**Personal / Executive Assistant (Part-Time, Flexible Schedule)**



“If you can juggle tenants, tradesmen, and spreadsheets without losing your sense of humour, we need to talk.”*



---



About the Role



We’re looking for an **experienced, detail-driven Real Estate VA** based in the Philippines to help manage a UK property portfolio and handle light bookkeeping in **Xero**.



This isn’t traditional property management — you’ll act as the **middle person** between us and our letting/management agencies, making sure everything runs smoothly.



If a maintenance issue pops up, a refinance needs chasing, or a P&L doesn’t balance, you’ll be the one who notices and gets it sorted.



You’ll also help us develop and maintain **AI automations** that improve how we run the business, so being tech-curious (or eager to learn) is a big plus.



---



Hours & Flexibility



* Around **15 - 20 hours per week**, averaging **2–4 hours a day**

* Some days may be heavier or lighter depending on workload

*Must be available and responsive during UK business hours to monitor property updates, messages, and urgent alerts

*You’ll need to keep notifications on and stay reachable for emergencies — the workload is moderate, but reliability and responsiveness are key

*We’re paying above average because this role requires consistent awareness and ownership, even when you’re not actively working on tasks

* No night shifts — family-friendly schedule

* Long-term role with flexibility and trust at its core



---



Key Responsibilities



* Produce weekly/monthly P&L in Xero snapshots and flag anomalies

* Log and reconcile income/expenses in **Xero**

*
 management

* Monitor and liaise with letting agents & contractors daily

* Track mortgages, purchases, refinances, insurances and paperwork

* Manage light admin (follow-ups, reminders, payments)

* Maintain dashboards for property & finance metrics

* Some Personal assistant tasks 

*Assist with AI tool setup (ChatGPT, Make, Zapier, etc.)



---



You’re Right for This If You…



* Already know **Xero** and can manage data entry confidently

* Have experience with **property or real-estate admin**

* Communicate clearly in written & spoken English

* Are proactive, organised, and reliable

* Enjoy tech, learning, and improving systems

* Have a stable internet connection and quiet workspace



---



Pay & Benefits



* **$750–$900 USD per month** depending on experience and initiative

* Paid PH public holidays

* 13th-month pay (after 12 months, prorated first year)

* Long-term, flexible contract



---



How to Apply



Please apply only by clicking the “Apply” button here on OnlineJobs.ph.

Do not
 or message me outside the platform — all applications must stay within OnlineJobs.ph so we can review your profile and DISC test together.



When you apply, include in your message:



Please send a short **Loom or video intro (max 2 minutes)** answering:



1. What’s your experience with **Xero** and property admin?

2. How do you stay organised and proactive in remote work?

3. Have you used or explored **AI tools** like ChatGPT, Make, or Zapier?

4. What does your daily routine look like, and how would flexible hours suit you?



Use the subject line **“I’m your Property + PA / EA”** when applying so we know you’ve read this.

title: Part-Time HR Support (Recruitment Focus)
description:
We’re looking for a reliable Part-Time HR Support teammate whose main focus is recruitment and hiring support. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys sourcing great candidates, keeping hiring pipelines organized, and conducting strong first-round interviews. There’s clear growth potential into a larger HR role as you demonstrate impact and ownership.

What you’ll do (Core Responsibilities)

- Support end-to-end recruiting for multiple roles (creative, marketing, ops, admin, etc.)

- Post jobs, refresh listings, and manage incoming applications

- Source candidates via LinkedIn, job boards, and outreach

- Conduct initial screening calls and structured interviews

- Coordinate interview scheduling, follow-ups, and candidate communication

- Maintain clean, accurate hiring records (spreadsheets/ATS, notes, status updates)

- Prepare shortlists and candidate summaries for hiring managers

- Help improve recruiting workflows, templates, and interview processes over time



What success looks like

- Consistent flow of qualified candidates week to week

- Fast, professional candidate communication

- Strong interview notes and clear recommendations

- Hiring pipelines that are organized, updated, and easy to review





Requirements

- Experience in recruiting, HR support, or talent acquisition (freelance, agency, or in-house)

- Comfortable leading interviews and asking structured questions

- Strong written English and professional communication

- Organized, responsive, and able to manage multiple open roles at once

- Confident with Google Workspace (Sheets/Docs) and basic hiring trackers



Nice to have

- Experience recruiting remote contractors and distributed teams

- Basic HR admin knowledge (onboarding checklists, documentation, etc.)



Growth opportunity

This is a part-time role with room to expand based on performance. If you consistently deliver strong hires and improve our hiring process, this can grow into a bigger role with broader HR responsibilities.



Compensation

- Competitive hourly rate based on experience

- Long-term opportunity for consistent work and role expansion



How to apply

Send the following:

- A short intro (2–4 sentences) about your recruiting experience

- Your resume/CV

- A brief example of roles you’ve recruited for (and your approach)

- Your availability per week and preferred working hours/timezone

 on Instagram (please include your handle in the application so we can verify).



Test Question to confirm you read this: What is the capital of Massachusetts?

title: Digital Growth & Optimization Specialist
description:
We are looking for a strategic Search & AI Visibility Manager to lead our transition from traditional SEO to the era of Generative Engine Optimization (GEO). Your mission is two-fold: drive high-quality backlinks that build our domain authority and ensure our brand is the "top-of-mind" recommendation for LLMs like ChatGPT, Claude, and Perplexity.



You aren't just chasing rankings; you are managing how the world—and the AI models that summarize it—perceives and cites our brand.



Key Responsibilities

1. High-Authority Backlink Strategy (Off-Page SEO)



Execute personalized outreach campaigns to secure placements on Tier-1 industry publications, news sites, and niche blogs.



Move beyond "spammy" tactics by building genuine relationships with editors and digital creators.



Conduct competitor gap analysis to identify missed opportunities for brand mentions and citations.



2. AI & LLM Optimization (GEO)



Optimize our digital footprint to ensure the brand is accurately "understood" and cited by AI models.



Monitor brand sentiment and "share of model" within AI-generated responses.



Work with the technical team to implement advanced 
 and JSON-LD structures that help LLMs parse our data more efficiently.



3. Content & Brand Integrity



Ensure all off-site content aligns with our brand voice and E-E-A-T (Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, and Trustworthiness) standards.



Audit "source-of-truth" platforms (Wikipedia, industry directories, Crunchbase) to ensure consistent data feeding into AI training sets.



Who You Are

The Strategic Connector: You know how to pitch a story that editors actually want to publish.



The AI Enthusiast: You aren't just using AI to write; you understand how LLMs crawl, process, and retrieve information.



Data-Driven: You are comfortable using tools like Ahrefs, Semrush, and Perplexity to track visibility and growth.



Technically Minded: You understand the basics of site architecture and how it influences crawler behavior.



Required Qualifications

3+ years in SEO, Digital PR, or Growth Marketing.



Proven track record of securing high-quality backlinks (be prepared to share examples).



Deep understanding of the evolving search landscape (SGE, Perplexity, etc.).



Exceptional writing and communication skills.

description:

- Communicate clearly and complete tasks on time.







----> What We’re Looking For



- Strong ability to spot patterns and trends.



- Coachable, adaptable, and motivated to improve.

- Basic comfort with spreadsheets (training provided).



- Reliable internet and good communication.





----> PERKS



- Flexible schedule within deadlines.

- Performance-based bonuses.



- Future career & earning potential growth





----> How to Apply

!!! Only applicants who follow all three steps will be considered.



This is not a simple admin job. Each product has its quirks, and you’ll be trained to use a clear process to validate products and become sharp on the charts. If you’re motivated and eager to learn, this role is for you.

This Is NOT For You If:

Compensation



Hourly rate

Performance-based bonuses



If you win, you get paid.

2–3 qualified calls booked per day



High show-up rate



Clean, organized tracking

Maverick & Kait Willett are founders of Elev8 Coaching.

Why you believe you’re a fit for this role

Your availability



A written sample DM response to this scenario:



A 42-year-old woman says:

Your resume



Your desired hourly rate

title: Accounting Operations Specialist
description:
Atlanta, Georgia Full-Time



Are you detail-driven, organized, and passionate about accounting accuracy? Do you thrive in a deadline-oriented environment where precision matters? We’re looking for an accounting operations specialist to join our growing finance team.



This role plays a critical part in managing accounts payable, petty cash, P-card transactions, and weekly reconciliations across multiple productions.



What You’ll Do

· Process vendor invoices and maintain accurate AP records

· Set up vendors and ensure W-9/tax compliance

· Manage petty cash accounts and advance requests

· Prepare and post journal entries

· Perform weekly P-card (Cashet) reconciliations

· Investigate discrepancies and resolve issues proactively

· Maintain organized, audit-ready financial documentation

· Communicate clearly with vendors, production staff, and leadership



What We’re Looking For

· 2+ years of accounting or accounts payable experience

· Strong Excel skills (comfortable working with spreadsheets and formulas) 

· Experience with accounting software (ERP systems preferred)

· Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy

· Strong written and verbal communication skills

· Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines 

· Professional discretion with confidential information

· Problem-solving mindset and high accountability



Bonus points for experience in production accounting or entertainment accounting.



Why Join Us?

· Collaborative team environment

· Opportunity to work closely with production teams

· Fast-paced and engaging accounting environment

· Competitive compensation and benefits



If you are highly organized, analytical, and confident in communicating with both internal teams and vendors, we’d love to hear from you.



Apply today and help us keep our financial operations running smoothly.

title: Do you love making people feel cared for? Support our CEOs as an Executive Personal Assistant!
description:
Title: Executive Personal Assistant



Important: Make sure to read the full listing for application instructions.



Do you love making people feel cared for? Are you the one who remembers everyone’s birthdays, plans amazing gatherings, makes fun plans, and brings warmth into the lives of those around you?



This is NOT your typical assistant job. It’s deeply personal. You’ll work with a kind but intense U.S.-based pair of brothers (proven entrepreneurs working as Co-CEOs of the same business) to support their lives, not the company they are building. From keeping friendships alive and planning meaningful experiences to sending thoughtful gifts and helping them stay on track with personal goals, you’ll be part organizer, part cheerleader, part coach. If you’ve ever been called the “mom” of your group and you’re looking for a decades-long position, this might be your dream job.



Your Role

* Build trust by executing on tasks and communicating clearly, which will lead to taking on more responsibility, which will then lead to increases in pay.

* Keep relationships thriving by managing a personal CRM and helping stay in touch with friends and family.

* Use technology to help automate certain tasks that are repetitive.

* Track habits, support routines, and act as an accountability partner for personal goals.

* Pick out thoughtful, creative gifts for birthdays and other special 
nts.

* Research products, tools, and ideas to make life easier, better, or more fun.

* Plan and book unforgettable travel, great hotels, and the perfect dinner spots.

* Jump in on special personal projects wherever a helping hand is needed.



What’s In It for You

* A Long-Term Role: This is meant to last. The entrepreneurs who you'd be an assistant to are looking for a lifetime assistant.

* Great Place to Work: These entrepreneurs are known to have a super high retention rate of employees and create a great work environment.

* Creative Work: From planning memorable trips to picking out the perfect gift, this role lets you flex your creative muscles and thoughtful side every day.

* Variety: No two days will feel the same. You’ll get to research, plan, coach, organize, and more.

* Paid Leave: You'll get at least 10 days of paid leave plus major holidays.

* Remote Flexibility: Work from the comfort of your home and gain flexibility with hours once trust is built.



Desired Attributes

* Extremely caring, social people-person who will excel in personal tasks

* High attention to detail and organizational skills

* Very strong written and oral English skills

* Minimum 50 Mbps Internet Speed

* Designated office space in your home



To apply and ensure your application is considered, do all of the following two steps:

1. DM with a quick introduction to yourself if you're interested. Include the word "cupcake" *in your subject line*, and Include your resume. ++Bonus points for a video introduction, though it's not strictly required

2. Fill out this form:

3.  Add the Letters "PA" in the "What's your full name" field [E.g. PA - John Doe], so we know what role you are applying for.

title: executive assistant
description:
VA posting & assessment questions” 





LINK FOR SCREENING INTERVIEW RESPONSES:  





VIRTUAL ASSISTANT – SALES AND MARKETING SUPPORT



Part-Time, Growing Role

Location

Philippines (Remote)

Hours

Start at 10hours per week, with opportunity to grow to 20 hours and maybe more based on performance and business needs.

Compensation

Hourly compensation with performance-based incentives for sales that result in closed business.



Long-Term Opportunity

Yes. This role is intended to grow into a long-term working relationship.

________________________________________

ABOUT THE ROLE



We are seeking a highly reliable, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support sales outreach, client communication, and marketing workflows. This role begins part-time and is intentionally designed to grow as trust, skills, and results are demonstrated.

The Virtual Assistant will work directly with the business owner and will be entrusted with access to core systems, including a CRM,
 marketing platform, and shared Gmail account. A high level of integrity, discretion, and accountability is essential.

________________________________________

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Sales and Outreach Support

• Make cold and warm outbound calls to prospects using provided scripts and talking points

• Make follow-up and relationship calls to existing clients

• Track calls, notes, outcomes, and next steps accurately in the CRM and/or spreadsheets

• Support follow-up workflows that lead to appointments and closed sales

Marketing and
 Support

• Draft and send
 newsletters and
 blasts

• Experience with Constant Contact is preferred

• Organize, clean, and segment contact lists

• Maintain consistent branding, tone, and professionalism in all written communications

Systems and Workflow Management

• Update and manage CRM records accurately and consistently

• Maintain organized contact lists and call logs

• Follow clearly defined workflows and contribute to improving them over time

• Communicate progress, challenges, and results clearly and professionally

Bonus Skills (Preferred but Not Required)

• Light graphic design using Canva or similar tools

• Familiarity with marketing campaigns or funnels

• Experience supporting small business owners, publishers, or event-based organizations

________________________________________

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

• Excellent spoken and written English

• Comfortable making outbound phone calls

• Prior experience using CRM systems and
 marketing platforms

• Strong attention to detail and follow-through

• High level of trustworthiness and respect for confidentiality

• Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and meet deadlines

• Reliable internet connection and a quiet, professional calling environment

________________________________________

WHAT WE OFFER

• A respectful and professional working relationship

• Clear expectations, processes, and workflows

• Opportunity to grow hours and responsibilities over time

• Performance incentives tied to successful sales outcomes

• Long-term collaboration for the right candidate

________________________________________

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS

Applicants must answer the screening questions below thoroughly.

Short or generic responses will not be considered.

________________________________________

SCREENING AND INTERVIEW QUESTIONS

1. Sales and Calling Experience

• Please describe your experience making cold and warm outbound calls.

• What types of businesses or services were you calling for?

• Approximately how many calls did you make per day or per week?

2. Handling Rejection and Follow-Up

• How do you typically respond when a prospect is not interested?

• How do you handle a prospect who says, “Call me later”?

• Please explain your approach.

3. CRM and Systems Experience

• Which CRM and
 marketing platforms have you used?

• What tasks did you handle inside the CRM?

• How did you ensure accuracy and organization?

4.
 and Written Communication

• Please write a short sample follow-up
 to a prospect who received information about a business service but has not yet responded.

• This writing sample is required and will be reviewed carefully.

5. Trust and Confidentiality

• How do you ensure confidentiality and data security in your work?

• Have you previously worked in a role that required a high level of trust? Please explain.

6. Time Management and Accountability

• If you are given 10 hours per week, how do you plan and track your work to ensure productivity and results?

7. Performance Incentives

• This role includes bonuses for outreach that leads to closed sales.

• What motivates you more: hourly work, performance incentives, or a combination of both?

• Please explain why.

8. Growth and Commitment

• This role is designed to grow from 10 hours to 20 hours and potentially more per week.

• Are you comfortable with a gradual increase in hours?

• Are you seeking a long-term role?

9. Bonus Skills

• Please list any experience you have with graphic design tools such as Canva.

• Please describe any experience with marketing campaigns or newsletters.

• Please note any experience related to publishing, media, or event promotion.

title: Seeking a Sales Assicoate that will call and close leads
description:
**TO APPLY YOU MUST CREATE A SHORT VIDEO INTRODUCING YOURSELF AND WHY YOU WILL BE THE PEFERCT CANIDADTE FOR THIS POSITION.**



Sales Associate – Digital Product Training (75+ Calls Daily)



Position: Full-Time Sales Closer

Industry: Digital Products / Online Education

Location: Remote

Compensation: Base + Commission (High Earning Potential)



About Us



We are a fast-growing digital education company that helps entrepreneurs create and sell digital products. We host live trainings and sell an all-in-one Digital Products Creators Sales & Marketing System.



We are NOT looking for someone who “likes sales.”

We are looking for someone who lives and breathes closing.



Your Role: You will be responsible for calling warm leads daily from paid ads and a free training we conducted to:



* Sell tickets to our Digital Product Creators Mentorship Training

* Close sales for our Digital Product Creators Sales & Marketing System

* Follow up with prospects consistently

* Overcome objections confidently

* Hit daily call and revenue targets



You will be on the phone ALL DAY. This is a performance-driven role.



Daily Requirements



* Minimum 75-100 outbound calls per day

* Consistent follow-up via phone & SMS

* Daily reporting of:



Calls made

Conversations

Sales closed

Revenue generated

Comfortable handling objections and pushing for the close



Who We’re Looking For



You MUST have:



* Minimum **2+ years of phone sales experience**

* Strong closing skills

* Aggressive, confident, and results-driven personality

* Thick skin (you will hear “no” often)

* Ability to build urgency and create excitement

* High energy and professional tone on calls

* Reliable internet and quiet workspace



This is NOT for beginners.

This is for closers who want to win.



Compensation



* Competitive base pay

* Commission on every sale

* Performance bonuses for hitting targets

* High income potential for top performers



If you cannot handle rejection, high call volume, or aggressive targets — this role is not for you.



???? To Apply



Send:



1. A short video (2–3 minutes) introducing yourself and why you will be the perfect canidate for this position

2. Your sales experience (include metrics if possible)

3. Your average daily call volume in past roles

title: Senior Accountant & CPA
description:
Senior Accountant & Finance Systems Architect

CPA Preferred | 10+ Years Experience | Hybrid/Remote



About the Role

We're hiring a Senior Accountant who operates at the intersection of accounting rigor and operational engineering. This is not a traditional accounting seat. We need a seasoned CPA who has lived in the trenches of hedge funds, high-growth startups, and complex multi-entity operations—and who brings the rare ability to build scalable, automated finance systems from the ground up.

You'll own the full finance function: month-end close, financial reporting, forecasting, compliance, and investor-ready deliverables. What sets this role apart is the expectation that you will also architect and automate the systems behind these processes—leveraging SQL, Brex, and modern tooling to eliminate manual work, improve data integrity, and unlock strategic insight.



What You'll Own

Financial Reporting & Close

Lead monthly, quarterly, and year-end close processes across multiple entities and currencies. Prepare US GAAP-compliant financial statements, management reports, and board-ready materials. Own revenue recognition, accruals, journal entries, intercompany eliminations, and reconciliations. Manage fund accounting, NAV calculations, and investor reporting as applicable.

Forecasting, Budgeting & Strategic Finance

Build and maintain dynamic forecasting and cash flow models that inform executive decision-making. Lead annual budgeting cycles and deliver monthly variance analysis with actionable narrative. Partner with leadership on scenario planning, capital allocation, and profitability analysis.

Finance Systems & Automation

Design, build, and maintain automated financial workflows that eliminate manual bottlenecks. Write SQL queries (PostgreSQL) for financial reporting, data extraction, and reconciliation at scale. Develop Python scripts for trading system integrations, API-driven data pipelines, and financial automation. Build BI dashboards  and custom reporting systems for real-time financial visibility. Implement AI-assisted process optimization to continuously improve finance operations.

Compliance, Tax & Legal Coordination

Oversee payroll processing, sales tax compliance, and government reporting requirements. Manage government compliance filings, loan applications, and audit preparation. Coordinate with external counsel and auditors on contract reviews, regulatory matters, and legal documentation.



Requirements

Non-Negotiables



Active CPA license in good standing

10+ years of progressive accounting experience spanning fund accounting, startup finance, and/or multi-entity operations

Deep expertise in US GAAP financial reporting, monthly close, and consolidation

Proficiency in SQL (PostgreSQL preferred) for financial data querying and reporting

Hands-on experience with Python for financial automation, API integrations, or trading system support

Advanced Excel and Google Sheets skills including complex nested formulas, financial models, and automated dashboards

Demonstrated ability to design and implement process automation and scalable finance workflows

Experience with QuickBooks Online in a multi-entity environment



Strongly Preferred



Background in hedge fund accounting, NAV reporting, or alternative investment operations

Experience with BI/analytics platforms

Familiarity with Microsoft Access for custom reporting systems

Track record managing payroll, sales tax, and multi-state compliance

Experience with government loan applications (SBA, PPP, EIDL, or similar)

Comfort operating in fast-paced, resource-constrained environments where you build the plane while flying it





What Sets You Apart

You don't just close the books—you ask why the process took 10 days and engineer it down to 3. You see a messy reconciliation and build a powered pipeline to handle it. You understand that clean financial data is a strategic asset, not just a compliance obligation. You move fluidly between debits and credits, scripts, and board presentations.

The ideal candidate combines the analytical discipline of a Big 4-trained accountant with the builder's mindset of a startup operator. You're equally comfortable presenting to investors, debugging a data pipeline, and negotiating with auditors.

title: DM Appointment Setter [Part-time / Flexible]
description:
We’re a creator-led fitness and performance brand operating a fast-growing free community on Skool that ascends qualified members into a premium, high-ticket coaching program.



Our goal is simple: turn engaged community members into booked sales calls through real conversations.



We run a lean, execution-focused operation. People who perform well in this role will grow into higher-leverage positions as the brand scales.



We are hiring a DM Appointment Setter to manage 1:1 conversations inside Skool DMs and ascend qualified community members into booked sales calls.



This role operates directly from the creator / Skool community owner’s account, meaning you will be speaking on behalf of the brand. You must be professional, emotionally intelligent, and capable of representing the creator’s voice accurately.



Your primary responsibility is to:

 • Start conversations with new and active Skool members

 • Build rapport and understand their situation

 • Provide relevant resources inside the Skool community when appropriate

 • Guide qualified members toward booking a sales call via Calendly



Your success is measured by qualified calls booked from the free community.



Soft Skills (Required)



• Strong written communication

• High emotional intelligence

• Comfortable initiating and holding conversations

• Professional judgment when speaking as a brand/creator

• Proactive and self-directed

• Ability to follow structure while adapting to real conversations

• Results-driven mindset



Basic Skills



• Fluent written English

• Comfortable using Skool and DM-based communication

• Google Docs and Sheets

• Ability to follow SOPs and conversation frameworks

• Familiarity with Calendly or similar scheduling tools



Required Experience



• DM-based sales, appointment setting, or community engagement experience

• Experience moving conversations toward a clear CTA (booking a call)

• Understanding qualification vs. disqualification

• Ability to handle objections naturally in conversation

• Experience speaking on behalf of a brand, coach, or creator



Desired Experience



• Experience working inside Skool, Slack, 
, or similar communities

• Experience with high-ticket offers ($3k–$10k+)

• Fitness, coaching, or personal development industry familiarity

• Experience managing multiple DM conversations simultaneously



Detailed Responsibilities



• DM new Skool members as they join the community

• Engage active members showing buying signals

• Hold 1:1 conversations inside Skool DMs from the creator’s account

• Ask qualifying questions to understand goals, problems, and readiness

• Share relevant community resources, posts, or videos when helpful

• Maintain a helpful, non-pushy tone aligned with the brand

• Move qualified members toward booking a sales call

• Send Calendly links at the appropriate time

• Follow up until a clear outcome is reached (booked call or disqualified)



Samples of the Type of Work You’ll Do



• Skool DM conversations

• Qualification and discovery messaging

• Resource sharing inside the Skool community

• Call booking and follow-up messages



Work Schedule & Structure



• Part-time role

• 1–3 hours per day

• Fully remote

• Flexible schedule, results-focused



Compensation



• $5–$6 USD per hour

• Performance-based bonuses tied to booked calls and/or closes

• Paid bi-weekly via Wise



Training Provided



• Full onboarding on the offer, audience, and positioning

• Pre-written DM scripts and SOPs

• Qualification criteria and escalation rules

• Ongoing feedback and performance optimization



Career Potential



• Increased responsibility as volume increases

• Higher pay tied to performance

• Opportunity to grow into senior setter or community leadership roles

• Long-term position with a growing brand



How to Apply



Please submit:

• Your resume/CV

• A 3–5 minute Loom video covering:

– Your experience with DM sales or appointment setting

– How you handle conversations and objections

– Any experience speaking on behalf of a brand or creator



Applications that do not follow instructions will not be considered.



We’re hiring ASAP and looking for someone who wants a long-term role, not a short-term gig. Scripts and training are provided — we’re looking for someone who executes, thinks independently, and is measured by results.

title: Content & Social Media Growth Manager (Instagram, Youtube, Facebook)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE (read this carefully)



We are a well-established real estate team in British Columbia (Canada) with 20+ years of experience. Our goal is to grow a strong personal brand on Instagram, YouTube, and
 that builds trust, attracts followers, and generates real business (not vanity metrics). 



This is not a simple posting or scheduling job. We don’t want someone to just "post." We want a growth hacker who can turn 20 years of real estate wisdom into viral, high-conversion content across YouTube, Instagram, and
.



We are looking for someone who understands how content grows, how social media platforms work, and how to turn videos into reach, followers, and inbound leads. We are looking for one smart, creative person to manage and grow our social media presence.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITY



Your job is to grow our online presence using smart content strategy and execution across:



 - Instagram (Reels, Carousels, Stories)

 - YouTube (long-form + Shorts)

 -
 (Reels + Page content)

You will plan content, guide what gets created, package it correctly for each platform, and improve results over time.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PLATFORMS YOU WILL MANAGE



 - Instagram (Reels, Carousels, Stories)

 - YouTube (Long-form videos + Shorts)

 -
 (Reels + Page content)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT YOU WILL DO (day-to-day)



Your role is to plan, improve, and grow our social media presence.



 - Plan weekly content ideas for Instagram, YouTube, and

 - Write strong hooks, captions, titles, descriptions and outlines for Reels, Shorts, and long videos

 - Help d
 what videos to create and how to structure them

 - Turn one long YouTube video into multiple short clips for IG + FB

 - Optimize titles, thumbnails, descriptions, and captions

 - Advise on on-camera delivery and content angles

 - Track performance and improve content every week

 - Suggest new content formats, series, and growth ideas

 - Help position the brand as a trusted real estate authority

 - Develop a cross-platform content calendar that balances Reels, YouTube Shorts, Long-form educational videos, and high-value Carousels

 - Take Sonny’s raw expertise and script it into engaging content that stops the scroll.

 - Identify industry and audio trends early and adapt them for a professional real estate brand

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

INSTAGRAM (must understand deeply)



 - How Reels grow (hook, retention, saves, shares)

 - How to turn views into followers

 - How Stories build trust and drive DMs

 - How to structure content that gets shared by non-followers

 - Why some reels fail and how to fix them

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

YOUTUBE (must understand deeply)



 - How to grow a personal brand channel (not viral clips only)

 - Titles and thumbnails that increase CTR

 - Structuring long-form videos to keep viewers watching

 - Using Shorts to support long-form growth

 - Writing strong titles and designing thumbnails

 - Basic YouTube analytics (CTR, watch time, retention)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 (must understand clearly)



 - 
 Reels and videos for

 - Page growth and local reach strategy

 - Understanding what content works better on FB vs IG

 - Local reach and engagement strategies

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TIKTOK (must understand clearly)



 - Grow our TikTok account using original, platform-native content

 - Plan and publish TikTok videos focused on discovery and reach

 - Write strong, scroll-stopping hooks for the first 1–2 seconds

 - Test multiple angles, hooks, and formats consistently

 - Turn real estate expertise into engaging, easy-to-understand videos

 - Repurpose long-form content into TikTok-specific clips

 - Engage with comments and turn comments into new videos

 - Track performance and improve content weekly

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

GOOGLE MY BUSINESS



  - Post regular updates (listings, announcements, market insights, offers)

 - Upload new photos and short videos consistently

 - Write keyword-optimized post captions

 - Update business info (services, hours, contact details, descriptions)

 - Add and maintain products/services listings

 - Track insights (views, searches, clicks, calls, direction requests)

 - Identify top-performing posts and replicate winning content

 - Report monthly performance and improvement recommendations

 - Ensure branding consistency across all posts and visuals

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What we are NOT looking for:



 - Someone who only schedules posts

 - Someone who relies mainly on hashtags

 - Someone who copies trends without strategy

 - Someone managing 10+ unrelated clients

 - Someone who cannot explain why content works

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SKILL AND EXPERIENCE



 - Experience growing social media accounts (personal brand or business)

 - Strong understanding of short-form and long-form video

 - Ability to think creatively and strategically and content ideas

 - Comfort working with a confident, on-camera professional

 - Ability to analyze numbers and adjust content accordingly

 - You have successfully grown a brand's following and, more importantly, their engagementand lead flow.

 - You know the difference between a YouTube thumbnail that gets clicks and one that gets ignored.

 - Real estate experience is a bonus, not required.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TOOLS YOU SHOULD BE COMFORTABLE WITH:



 - Instagram, YouTube Studio,

 - CapCut / AI Video Editing tools

 - Basic analytics and reporting

 - Google Docs / Sheets / Notion (or similar)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

HOW SUCCESS WILL BE MEASURED



 - Increased reach and engagement

 - Growth in followers and subscribers

 - Better watch time and retention

 - More profile visits, DMs, and inbound inquiries

 - Strong, consistent brand positioning

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

HOW TO APPLY



Please include:



 1. Links to accounts you’ve helped grow (with results)

 2. A short explanation of how you would grow a real estate personal brand

3. One example of a video or post you believe performed well and why



Applications without examples or explanations will not be considered.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please answer the following:



 1. Links to social media accounts you have helped grow

 2. Briefly explain how you would grow a real estate personal brand

 3. Share one video or post you worked on that performed well and explain why



Applications without clear answers will not be considered.

title: Social Media & YouTube Marketing Manager (Real Estate)
description:
We’re looking for a strategic Social Media & YouTube Marketing Manager, not just a content poster.



This is a long-term, full-time role for someone who understands brand building, YouTube growth, video strategy, ads, and AI-powered marketing—someone who can think ahead, analyze data, and help grow a recognizable real estate brand with minimal supervision.



This role is not task-based. You will own the marketing direction, especially for YouTube and social platforms.



CORE FOCUS AREAS (VERY IMPORTANT)

- Brand Building – 60%

- Video Editing & Content Execution – 30%

- Other - 10%



PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES



1. YouTube

YouTube is our #1 growth channel.

You will be responsible for end-to-end YouTube management, including:



Long-form YouTube Content:

- Create high-converting thumbnails

- Write SEO-optimized titles, descriptions, and tags

- Use VidIQ for keyword research, optimization, and competitive analysis

- Upload, schedule, and publish videos

- Track performance, analytics, CTR, watch time, retention, and growth

- Continuously improve content based on data



YouTube Shorts:

- Repurpose long-form content into Shorts

- Edit, format, caption, and schedule Shorts

- Optimize hooks, pacing, and visuals for engagement



YouTube Ad

- Manage YouTube ad campaigns

- Support creative testing, hooks, thumbnails, and targeting

- Monitor performance and suggest improvements



2. Instagram &

You’ll manage and grow our presence across Meta platforms with a marketing-first mindset, not just posting.

- Create and edit Reels (intermediate level required)

- Design and schedule posts, carousels, and stories

- Write captions with strong hooks and CTAs

- Applicants must use Real Estate SMM

- Boost posts and manage sponsored content

- Handle Meta Ads at an intermediate level:

· Campaign setup

· Scheduling

· Basic optimization and monitoring

- Ensure consistency in branding, tone, and visuals



3. Google Presence & Analytics

- Manage Google My Business:

· Posts

· Updates

· Reviews

· Products/services

- Monitor Google Analytics and performance data

- Track how content and traffic support brand visibility and lead generation



4. Marketing Manager Responsibilities

You are not just executing — you are thinking like a manager.

- Plan content calendars aligned with business goals

- Propose campaigns and growth ideas

- Analyze what’s working and what’s not

- Report insights clearly and simply

- Coordinate with leadership on strategy and priorities



5. AI & Innovation

We expect you to use AI intelligently, not blindly.

- Use tools like ChatGPT, Canva AI, AI video tools, etc.

- Speed up workflows while maintaining quality

- Suggest better systems, tools, and processes

- Stay updated on trends in AI, marketing, and content creation



BASIC REQUIREMENTS

- Minimum 2 years of experience in Social Media Marketing or Digital Marketing

- Real estate experience is a strong advantage

- Proven experience managing YouTube channels

- Strong understanding of branding and content strategy

- Intermediate video editing skills (Reels, Shorts)

- Intermediate experience with Meta Ads

- Comfortable working independently with minimal supervision

- Strong communication, organization, and time management skills



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR

- Someone who thinks strategically

- Someone who understands YouTube as a growth engine

- Someone who cares about branding, consistency, and results

- Someone who takes ownership and doesn’t wait for instructions



- This role is not for beginners

- This role is not for task-only executors



COMPANY OVERVIEW

We are a BC, Canada–based real estate team focused on modern marketing, strong branding, and long-term growth. We value ownership, creativity, and people who think ahead.



HOW TO APPLY

To apply, please:

Send your resume / CV

Include portfolio links:

YouTube channels managed

Don't use "Rockstar VA" in your application. Read carefully again to find the correct term to use.

Thumbnails you’ve created

Reels / Shorts

Ads or campaigns you’ve worked on



We’re not looking for “just an SMM.”

We’re looking for someone who can build a brand and grow an audience.



- IMPORTANT: SKILLS TEST / TRIAL TASK -

We’ve hired many SMMs before, and not everyone performs at the level they claim.

Because of this, we will hire based on performance, not interviews.

Shortlisted applicants will complete a practical test.

The fastest and highest-quality submission will be hired.

title: Appointment Setter (Warm Leads) — CLEAR AMERICAN ACCENT REQUIRED — Help Seniors Get the Care They Deserve
description:
Feel great about your work every day. You’ll be the friendly voice that helps seniors and their families get the **in-home care** they need — no hard selling, just guidance, empathy, and clear next steps.



Why this role matters



We’re a marketing agency focused on the home care industry, operating for 6 years and growing fast. You’ll turn warm inquiries into scheduled consultations so care teams can step in and help. If you love talking to people, staying organized, and making a real difference, you’ll thrive here.



Compensation and growth



* **Base:** $750/month

* **Bonus:** +$25 per qualified appointment you book

* **Recent performance:** The last person in this role earned $1,445 in a month. We’re actively adding new clients, which means more opportunities.

* Additional commission opportunities and performance bonuses for hitting KPIs.



What you’ll do



* Answer inbound calls from seniors and family members seeking help at home.

* Call back warm leads who fill out online forms — qualify and book them on client calendars.

* Act as a trusted advisor: listen, clarify needs, and guide them to the right next step.

* Keep records tidy: update Asana and our CRM so our Ads and Client teams have clean data.

* Join regular team huddles and training sessions to keep sharpening your skills.

* **Note:** This is not cold calling. It’s professional, caring communication.



What we’re looking for



* A **self-starter** with a friendly, confident phone presence.

* Reliable, organized, and accountable — you answer the phone when scheduled.

* Excellent English conversational skills; must be easily understood by US seniors.

* **Very important:** A clear, natural-sounding American accent.

* No experience? No problem. If you bring a strong work ethic, we’ll teach you everything.



How to apply



Record a short 2–3 minute video introducing yourself. Please cover:



1. Who you are.

2. Your previous experience (any kind — customer service counts!).

3. Why you’re interested in this role and why you’d be a great fit.



**The video is required so we can hear your phone presence.**

We aim to have this style of content:  




==



Main Responsibility  



Your primary responsibility is editing short-form videos.



You must be able to:  



- Edit Reels and TikTok videos

- Create strong hooks in the first 3 seconds

- Add captions and subtitles

- Use smooth transitions

- Make before-and-after transformations look premium

- Turn raw footage into engaging short-form content



If you are not confident in your editing skills, please do not apply.



Workflow (Important)  



- You will receive raw footage + a reference style from us.

- You deliver final edits + project files (so we can reuse/edit assets later).

- You understand and apply current social media trends (hooks, pacing, sound choices, formats) and can translate trends into our brand style.



Additional Tasks  



- Suggest content ideas

- Assist with content planning

- Write short captions

- Schedule posts



Video editing represents approximately 70% of this role.



Requirements  



- Experience with CapCut, Premiere Pro, or similar software

- Experience editing short-form content

- Good English communication skills

- Reliable internet connection

- Available 12 hours per week



Growth Opportunity  



We are looking for someone long-term. As the company grows, there is the opportunity to:  



- Increase working hours

- Increase salary

- Take on more responsibility

- Grow into a full-time role

- Potentially become Head of Content in the future



If you perform well, you will grow with the business.



Payment  



We pay $3.50 USD per hour, starting at 12 hours per week. We aim to post 1 short-form video per day. Hours may increase as the company grows.



Trial  



Shortlisted candidates will do a paid trial edit (1 video).



Rights (Work-for-Hire)  



All edits are work-for-hire. Elite Keukens owns the final videos and may use them for organic content and ads.



How to Apply  



To be considered:  



1. Send 3 examples of short-form videos you edited.  

2. Tell us which editing software you use.  

3. Briefly explain how you would make a kitchen transformation video go viral.  



Applications that do not follow these steps will not be reviewed.

title: Executive Assistant to CEO
description:
Executive Assistant to CEO, AI-First Startup



Full-time | CST/PST Hours | Remote | Long-term



We’re hiring an Executive Assistant for the CEO of an AI-powered customer retention company backed by one of North America’s top SaaS mentors. This is not a standard VA role this person will run the CEO’s life, including inbox, calendar, travel, finances, health appointments, and operational support across two ventures.



What makes this role different:

•  Everything we do is AI-native. You won’t just use AI tools,  you’ll help build AI-powered systems and workflows. Your role will evolve as AI takes over routine tasks, and you’ll grow into a Chief of Staff position.

•  The CEO operates at high pace. You need to be someone who can keep up, stay calm under pressure, and proactively solve problems before they’re asked about.

•  You’ll have full access to the CEO’s life; inbox, passwords, health records, financial accounts. Trust and confidentiality are non-negotiable.

•  This is a growth opportunity. We’re early stage and moving fast. If you want a predictable 9-5, this isn’t it. If you want to build something alongside a founder, keep reading.



You MUST have:

•  2+ years supporting a founder, CEO, or executive

•  Experience using AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Perplexity, or similar) in your daily work

•  Strong written and spoken English

•  Google Workspace proficiency (Gmail, Calendar, Drive)

•  Availability during CST/PST business hours (7 AM – 4 PM CST)



Bonus if you have:

•  HubSpot CRM experience

•  Familiarity with automation tools (Zapier, Make, Google Apps Script)

•  SaaS or tech startup experience

•  Notion or Asana experience



HOW TO APPLY:

Do NOT just send your resume. Applications without the following will be automatically rejected:

1.  Your resume/CV

2.  A 5-minute Loom video (see instructions below)

3.  In the subject line, include the word “LATCH” so we know you read the full posting



VIDEO INSTRUCTIONS:

Record a 5-minute Loom video (free at 
) where you:

1.  Introduce yourself and share your background supporting executives

2.  Show us a real example of how you’ve used AI in your work (screen share encouraged)

3.  Tell us what excites you about working with an AI-first company

4.  Describe a situation where you had to figure something out that you’d never done before

Compensation: Competitive, based on experience. Full-time position with growth into Chief of Staff.

title: HR Admin Assistant
description:
Work Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8am - 5pm Pacific Time

Work Setup: Fully Remote



Position Overview

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented HR Administrative Assistant to support our growing remote workforce. This role focuses on onboarding support, HR documentation, timekeeping management, and employee engagement while maintaining professional communication with US-based clients and Filipino recruits.

The ideal candidate has strong HR admin experience, excellent communication skills, empathy balanced with professionalism, and the initiative to improve processes without constant supervision.



Key Responsibilities

a. HR Administration

• Assist with onboarding newly hired recruits, including documentation, orientation scheduling, and account setup coordination.

• Maintain and monitor daily time records, attendance, and PTO credits for 50+ and growing remote employees.

• Keep HR files, recruit records, and client documents accurate, updated, and organized.

• Ensure HR compliance with company policies and client requirements.



b. Employee & Client Support

• Conduct monthly or bi-monthly check-ins with recruits and provide structured feedback reports to clients.

• Respond to HR-related inquiries from recruits and clients in a timely and professional manner.

• Support employee engagement activities and help address concerns while maintaining policy compliance.



c. Coordination

• Work closely with recruiters, managers, and clients to ensure smooth onboarding and employee support.

• Assist in policy communication, reminders, and HR announcements.



Qualifications

Required

• At least 3+ years of experience in an HR Admin, HR Assistant, or similar role.

• Strong written and verbal English communication skills and comfortable speaking with US clients.

• Experience handling employee onboarding, documentation, and timekeeping.

• Highly organized with strong attention to detail.

• Ability to balance empathy with policy enforcement.

• Self-starter with initiative and problem-solving mindset.

• Experience working remotely with distributed teams.



Preferred

• Experience in a recruitment/outsourcing environment.

• Familiarity with HRIS

• Basic knowledge of Philippine labor practices and remote work policies.

• Experience supporting 50+ employees.

title: Webflow Developer (UI Redesign – Design Already Chosen, Possible Long-Term Role)
description:
--------------------------------------------------------

JOB DESCRIPTION:

--------------------------------------------------------



IMPORTANT – Design Is Already Selected



We already chose the design direction.



You are NOT designing from scratch.



You will follow a reference website (
) and replicate a similar layout, spacing, structure, and visual style inside our existing Webflow project.



We will provide all text content, all images, clear layout direction, and the reference design. Your job is to execute cleanly and professionally inside Webflow.



--------------------------------------------------------

PROJECT OVERVIEW:

--------------------------------------------------------



We are redesigning our existing website (
) inside the same Webflow project.



This is NOT a rebuild.



We are improving layout, spacing, typography, structure, visual consistency, and overall UX clarity.



We are keeping all URLs, all slugs, all H1 and headline structure, all keywords, all core text, and the existing SEO structure.



--------------------------------------------------------

SCOPE OF WORK:

--------------------------------------------------------



You will redesign the website layout by simplifying the homepage, improving white space, improving typography hierarchy, cleaning up service sections, reducing unnecessary animations, improving mobile responsiveness, and improving overall visual professionalism to give it an enterprise-level B2B feel.



You will also build two new pages.



The first is a Blog section using Webflow CMS. This includes a blog index page, a blog template page, a clean minimal design, and an SEO-ready structure.



The second is a Shipping page. This will be a static layout with proper internal linking and clean structure.



All content will be provided.



--------------------------------------------------------

SEO REQUIREMENTS (IMPORTANT):

--------------------------------------------------------



You must preserve URLs and slugs, preserve page titles and meta descriptions, preserve H1 structure, maintain internal linking, not remove indexed text, optimize images for speed, improve page performance where possible, and keep schema intact.



Basic SEO knowledge is required.



--------------------------------------------------------

TIMELINE

--------------------------------------------------------



Needs to be done as soon as possible.



--------------------------------------------------------

POSSIBILE LONG-TERM OPPORTUNITY 

--------------------------------------------------------



We are building a long-term brand.



After this project, we will need ongoing Webflow updates, blog layout improvements, landing page creation, conversion optimization, feature additions, UI improvements, A/B testing, and technical SEO support.

We are looking for a long-term website partner.

--------------------------------------------------------

TO APPLY

--------------------------------------------------------



Please include portfolio, your hourly rate and estimated hours for this project. 



--------------------------------------------------------

WORKING STYLE & EXPECTATIONS

--------------------------------------------------------



We are not looking to micromanage or make this stressful. Our goal is simple: build a clean, professional website efficiently.



We will provide clear instructions, all content, all images, and a clear reference design. We respect your time and want to make this as smooth as possible.



If you are reliable and communicate clearly, this will be a very straightforward and low-stress project.



We believe in long-term partnerships built on trust, clarity, and respect.



To prove that you have read this entire job post, include the word CONFIRMATION at the very top of your application message.

title: Prior Authorization Specialist (Full-time and Remote)
description:
Role Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Prior Authorization Specialist to support US-based healthcare practices. In this role, you will ensure timely approval of medical services, procedures, and medications by coordinating with providers, insurance companies, and patients.



Your work will directly impact treatment timelines, reimbursement accuracy, and overall patient experience.



Key Responsibilities

1. Prior Authorization Processing

-Review medical service requests and determine prior authorization requirements

-Gather and compile supporting documentation including medical records, test results, and clinical notes

-Prepare and submit prior authorization requests in accordance with payer guidelines

-Track submissions and follow up proactively to prevent delays



2. Insurance Verification

-Verify patient eligibility, benefits, and coverage limitations

-Confirm authorization requirements prior to scheduled services

-Document insurance details accurately to support clean claims processing



3. Communication & Coordination

-Communicate with insurance representatives regarding authorization status

-Coordinate with providers to obtain missing documentation or clarifications

-Provide timely updates to internal teams regarding approval status



4. Appeals & Denials Management

-Assist with appeals for denied authorizations

-Analyze denial patterns and identify root causes

-Collaborate with providers and payers to resolve issues efficiently



5. Compliance & Documentation

-Maintain organized and accurate records of all submissions and follow-ups

-Stay current with payer policies, CPT/ICD-10 updates, and authorization guidelines

-Ensure full compliance with HIPAA and US healthcare regulations



Required Qualifications:

-Proven experience in Prior Authorization for US healthcare practices

-Strong knowledge of CPT, ICD-10, and medical terminology

-Familiarity with US insurance plans and reimbursement workflows

-Experience working with EHR systems and healthcare platforms

-Excellent written and verbal communication skills

-Highly organized with strong attention to detail

-Ability to manage multiple cases in a fast-paced environment



Technical and Work-from-Home Requirements:

Laptop: 8th generation Intel Core i5 (8000 series) or better, or AMD Ryzen equivalent

Desktop: AMD Ryzen 5 (3000 series or higher) or Intel Core i3 (10th generation or higher)

Mac:

-Core i5 (2017 or newer)

-Core i7 (2016 or newer)

-Core i3 not recommended

Reliable work-from-home setup located in the Philippines

Stable internet connection with minimum 50 Mbps speed

Backup internet connection required

Availability: Comfortable working US hours (Eastern or Pacific Time Zone)



What We Offer:

Competitive Salary –  ?55,000-?60,000 per month

Paid Time Off – Take the time you need to recharge and unwind.

Attendance Bonus – Rewarding your commitment and reliability every month.

100% Work-from-Home – Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely.

title: High-Ticket Closer — AI Agency $400 Commission Per Sale · 15-Minute Demo Calls
description:
Two closes in a week is $800. Two closes every week for a month is $3,200. Our top target is 4 closes a week, that's $1,600 in a single week. We send you warm, pre-qualified demo slots. Your job is to run the 15-minute call, show them a live AI demo, walk through the ROI math, and collect payment on the call. The product sells itself once they hear the demo, we need a closer who knows how to seal it without letting them leave to "think about it."



What You'll Be Doing

We sell an AI voice agent to MedSpas, clinics that are losing patients every day to missed calls. Our setters book you onto 15-minute demo calls with clinic owners and practice managers. You show up, run the call on a proven script, have them call a live demo number on speaker so they hear the AI themselves, anchor the ROI math, and close.



Hard Disqualifiers

If you cannot handle objections live on camera, this role is not for you. If you need a base salary, this role is not for you. If "let me think about it" ends your deals, this role is not for you. We run a script-based process with zero tolerance for soft-closing. The Loom screening is non-negotiable. No Loom = no review, no exceptions made for any reason.



How to Apply

01

Record a 90-second Loom. Tell us your name and high-ticket closing experience. Then handle this objection live on camera: "This sounds interesting but I think it's too expensive for us right now." We're watching how you respond — not just what you say.

02

Send your Loom link with your application. No Loom = no review. This is not negotiable.

03

If your Loom passes, you'll receive the demo script to review and a short roleplay test within 48 hours. Pass the roleplay and you start on your first live demos immediately.



Every demo ends one of three ways: payment collected on the call (ideal), payment promised within 24 hours, or a clear no. There is no "I'll think about it and get back to you." Your job is to make sure they make a decision before the call ends.

title: Creative Storyteller & Content Strategist for Tech/AI Creator
description:
I'm a tech/AI creator with 142K on Instagram, 280K on TikTok, and 18K on YouTube. My content about AI, robotics, and emerging technology has gone viral multiple times, my biggest videos have over 1M views. 



Right now I wear every hat, researching, scripting, strategizing, posting, community management, on top of being the one on camera. That means I'm only putting out 2-3 videos a week on Instagram and maybe 1 YouTube video every couple of months. I know I'm leaving massive growth on the table.



I'm hiring you so I can stop doing everything and start doing the one thing that matters most: creating. With the right person in this role, we go from 2-3 Instagram posts a week to posting daily. We go from almost no YouTube presence to consistent weekly long-form content. We start repurposing everything into a Substack newsletter. And we build a real, loyal community across every platform, not just a follower count.



I'm looking for a creative storyteller: someone who sees a story where other people see a headline, who instinctively knows what visuals would make a 
nt land harder, and who can help me turn complex technology into content that makes people feel something.



You can use AI tools to accelerate research, organize ideas, or get a rough draft started — I'm not anti-AI. But what you deliver to me needs to sound unmistakably human, have a clear point of view, and be something I'd be proud to record. If your process is "prompt ChatGPT, copy paste, send" — this isn't the role for you.



What you'll do:

Research AI/tech topics daily and develop 7-8 short-form video concepts per week, each with a strong hook, clear narrative structure, and an ending that makes the viewer feel something

Develop 1 long-form YouTube concept per week — full outline, script draft, and visual direction

Think visually — suggest what b-roll to capture, what should be on screen at each 
nt, what diagrams or visuals would make a concept click

Own the cross-platform content strategy with a focus on building a loyal, invested community

Create Instagram and LinkedIn carousels in Canva that are on-brand and shareable

Repurpose short-form and long-form scripts into Substack/newsletter articles

Cross-post and adapt content across IG, TikTok, LinkedIn, and YouTube — tailored for each platform, not just reposted

Respond to comments and DMs in my voice to build real relationships with the audience

Analyze what's working weekly and adjust the strategy



You must be:

A natural storyteller who understands narrative structure, pacing, and emotional beats

Genuinely curious about AI, tech, and science — you follow this space because you care

An excellent English writer whose work has voice, personality, and rhythm

Visually minded — you think about what the viewer SEES, not just what they hear

Someone who understands that community is built through trust and consistency, not tricks

Proficient in Canva and comfortable working across multiple social platforms

Self-directed, reliable, and proactive



Start: Immediate with 1-week paid trial

Why this role matters: This isn't a task-execution gig. You're coming in as the first creative partner on a brand that's actively growing with real revenue behind it. As the channel grows — more brand deals, more reach, more opportunities — this role grows with it. More hours, higher pay, expanded responsibility. I'm building a team and I want this person to be the foundation of it. If you help me build something big, you'll be a core part of it.



TO APPLY — You MUST complete all 4 steps below. Applications that skip any of these steps will not be considered, no exceptions.

1. Show me your work. Link to your portfolio, writing samples, scripts, carousels, or social media accounts you've managed. If you don't have a formal portfolio, show me anything that demonstrates your creative ability — a blog, a
 thread, a YouTube video, anything.

2. The Story Test. Find any recent piece of tech or AI news from the past week. Don't just tell me what happened — pitch me the 60-second video. What's the hook? What's the story? What's the 
nt that makes someone stop scrolling? And tell me one visual or b-roll idea that would make this video hit harder than just someone talking to camera.

3. The Community Question. What's the difference between a creator with 500K followers and low engagement versus a creator with 100K followers whose audience would buy anything they recommend? How do you build the second one? Be specific.

4. The Honesty Question. Tell me how you use AI tools in your creative process. What's it good for? Where do you draw the line? I want to know that you have a thoughtful relationship

title: Admin and Marketing Manager

title: Remote Video Editor – Long-Term VSL's (6+ Videos/Week)
description:
Contract | Remote | $10/video |  Bonus Opportunities



We’re looking for a creative and reliable Video Editor to join our growing remote team and help us produce high-performing Video Sales Letters (VSLs). These are 5 to 10 minute videos that combine AI voiceovers and TikTok-style B-roll to tell powerful, emotional stories that convert.



You’ll receive a full script, voiceover, and sample for each project — your job is to bring it to life with clean pacing, strong visuals, and smart editing.



What You’ll Be Doing:



Editing ~6 VSLs per week (with the option to take on more for bonus pay)



Using CapCut for editing



Matching visuals and music to scripted voiceovers created in ElevenLabs



Pulling B-roll from Canva Pro, stock footage, or TikTok-style content



Delivering emotional, clean, and scroll-stopping edits that match our storytelling style



What We Provide:



Fully written scripts + voiceovers



Brand assets & creative direction



Reference videos + tutorials



Organized folders for each project



Friendly, responsive feedback (we love working with editors who want to improve)



Pay & Bonuses:



$10 per video, depending on skill and experience



You’ll start with 6 videos/week



BONUS PAY available if you take on more than 6 videos (up to 15 total)



Room to grow into long-term creative roles (direction, scripting, ideation, etc.)



What We’re Looking For:



Strong skills in CapCut, Canva Pro, and TikTok-style editing



Fast turnaround & clean file delivery



Attention to detail — matching clips/emotion to script



Creative instincts: you think like a marketer



Ability to follow brand direction and iterate with feedback



Bonus: experience editing UGC, eCommerce, or VSLs



Why Work With Us?



We’re two partners growing beauty & wellness brands on Shopify. We value creativity, communication, and consistency — and we take care of the people we work with. We believe in fair pay, clear feedback, and long-term opportunities for those who want to grow with us.



If you’re looking to be part of a small, committed team where your creative input matters, we’d love to hear from you.



To Apply:



Send us:



A short intro message



Your portfolio (VSLs, TikTok-style edits, UGC-style work welcome)



Your rate per video



What kind of weekly volume you’re comfortable with to start



Looking forward to working with you!

title: FEA / Simulation Engineer – Composite Structural Validation
description:
FEA / Simulation Engineer – Composite Structural Validation (Short-Term Contract)



We are developing a next-generation, 3D-printed mobility device using high-performance composite materials (carbon-fiber-filled nylon / PPA-CF).



The CAD model is complete.



We are seeking an experienced FEA / simulation engineer to independently validate the structural integrity of the design before first print and real-world load testing.



This is a structural validation role, not a cosmetic redesign.





Critical Requirement



You must already own and operate professional-grade FEA software.



We will not be purchasing licenses, providing simulation tools, or covering software costs.



Applicants must have active access to advanced FEA software such as:



• ANSYS

• Abaqus

• SolidWorks Simulation (Professional/Premium)

• Fusion 360 Simulation Extension

• COMSOL

• Or equivalent nonlinear FEA software capable of structural load analysis



If you do not currently have access to professional simulation software, this role is not a fit.







Scope of Work



• Perform full structural FEA on an existing composite mobility device chassis

• Define realistic human load cases (static, dynamic, off-axis loading, impact, support surface loading)

• Model material behavior for reinforced thermoplastics

• Identify stress concentrations, excessive deflection, buckling risks, and potential failure points

• Evaluate stiffness and load paths

• Provide clear written interpretation of simulation results

• Recommend targeted geometry refinements if required



The design is built. Minor structural adjustments may follow based on simulation findings.



This is a focused validation sprint prior to committing to full production prints.







Required Experience



• Strong background in structural FEA for load-bearing products

• Experience simulating plastic or composite structures

• Ability to properly define boundary conditions and constraints

• Understanding of section modulus, stress distribution, and structural behavior

• Experience interpreting simulation results beyond visual stress plots







Preferred



• Experience with carbon-fiber-filled nylons or engineering polymers

• Experience validating products intended to carry human body loads

• Background in medical device, mobility, automotive, aerospace, or structural product design







How to Apply



Please include:



• The exact FEA software you currently own and use

• A short example of a load-bearing structure you validated

• The most complex material model you’ve worked with

• Confirmation that you have active access to professional simulation tools



Applications without confirmed software access will not be considered.

title: Virtual Acquisition Manager (Real Estate) – Follow Up Leads, Run Comps, Draft Contracts
description: We are a small real estate investing company (wholesaling) looking for a reliable, experienced Virtual Acquisition Manager to manage lead follow-up, talk to motivated sellers, run comps/ARV, calculate offer ranges, draft purchase agreements, and keep everything organized in our CRM. This is not a “dial all day” job only. Your priority is closing contracts from inbound + existing leads, then cold calling provided lists during downtime. What you will be working on (daily) Priority 1: Inbound & warm leads Follow up call center leads submitted into our CRM Follow up positive SMS replies (our campaigns + AI bot handle first response; you take over when a seller is interested) Answer calls/texts from our direct mail campaign during your working hours Call back missed calls and respond quickly during your shift Priority 2: Acquire deals Qualify sellers using MCTP (Motivation, Condition, Timeframe, Price) Ask the important questions (occupancy, decision maker, mortgage/liens/probate/tenants) Run comps to determine ARV and estimate repairs using our repair buckets Calculate MAO using our rules and propose an offer range Negotiate calmly and professionally (no pressure, no arguing) Draft contracts and prepare a complete deal file (James signs all contracts) Build a “deal packet” with notes, comps, photos (if available), and paperwork Priority 3: Downtime outreach Cold call lists we provide only when follow-up is caught up Log all activity and notes properly in the CRM Tools you will use GoHighLevel CRM (calls, texts, notes, pipelines) – you will have restricted access Discord (daily check-in/out, daily reporting, live lead handoff, training) Propwire (comps/ARV) + Zillow/Redfin for cross-checking Company VA Gmail account (for logins) Work schedule Full-time: 8 hours/day (Mon–Fri) Must be consistent and reliable We prefer someone who can overlap with US Eastern Time hours Pay $5–$8/hour depending on experience Bonuses: bonuses per signed/closed (negotiable based on experience) (Bonuses are paid only when CRM notes + the deal packet are complete and usable.) What we expect (non-negotiables) Excellent English communication (spoken and written) Strong follow-up discipline (no “lead leaks”) Clean CRM notes and organization (if it’s not in the CRM, it didn’t happen) Ability to run comps and explain ARV clearly (no inflated numbers) You must be comfortable drafting contracts carefully and accurately Professional, calm, and friendly tone with sellers Willing to sign an NDA Experience we prefer Real estate wholesaling acquisitions / ISA / lead manager experience Experience using a CRM (GoHighLevel is a plus) Experience with comps, ARV, basic repair estimation, and negotiating To apply (important) In your application, please include: A short paragraph about your real estate acquisitions experience Your internet speed + headset setup The tools you’ve used (CRMs, dialers, comp tools) A brief example of how you would respond to this seller message: “Your offer is too low. I’m not giving it away.” Your expected hourly rate ($5–$8) and confirmation you can work 8 hours/day

title: Vector Tracer / Pattern Digitizer
description:
Hi there! I am looking for a detail-oriented vector tracer to help me translate my physical patterns into digital vector files. We will be using Seamly2D, a free, open-source parametric pattern-making software. 



No prior Seamly2D experience? No problem! The software is completely free to download and has extensive, easy-to-follow tutorials online. If you have a good understanding of geometry, vector tracing (like Illustrator or AutoCAD), and are a quick learner, you will do great at this job.



I make stuffed animals. I create custom 3D patterns using tape, which I cut, lay flat, and scan. I need you to trace these tape patterns to turn them into precise digital/paper patterns.



Your responsibilities will be:



Vector Tracing: Trace the provided scanned duct tape pattern pieces accurately within Seamly2D.



Symmetry: Adjust the traced lines to ensure the final pattern pieces are perfectly symmetrical.



Parametric Seam Matching (Crucial): You must calculate and adjust the lengths of the curves/lines so that adjoining seams match perfectly when sewn together using Seamly2D's built-in tools.





The test:



To be considered for this job, I have a quick test for you to prove you can use the software and understand the math. It should only take about 10 minutes if you are familiar with vectors.



To Apply:



Please complete this test task: 







Then send me the seamly2d or .ai file with a link to download from google drive. 



I only expect you to spend 10 minutes if you're familiar with Seamly2D. If you only know Adobe Illustrator, you can try to do this task as well, just send me .AI file so that you dont have to learn. The requirement of a completed task is in the test document.
